translated: The knowledge arising from discrimination illuminates the knowledge of Śiva.🔽It is devoid of the two eyes and is free from external existence.

analyzed: lokānām parinirmuktam kāla akāla viloḍanam
translated: It is liberated from the worlds and transcends the distinction between time and non-time.

original: nityajñānaṃ paraṃ jñānaṃ taṃ viddhi prāṇagocaram // //
analyzed: nitya jñānam param jñānam tam viddhi prāṇa gocaram
translated: Know that eternal knowledge, the supreme knowledge, to be the sphere of the vital breath.

analyzed: mānuṣam sa phalam janma sarva śāstreṣu gocaram
translated: Human birth is fruitful, the sphere of all scriptures.

analyzed: caturaśīti lakṣeṣu śarīreṣu śarīriṇām
translated: Among the 84 lakh types of bodies of embodied beings,

original: na mānuṣyaṃ vinānyatra tattvajñānaṃ tu vidyate /
analyzed: na mānuṣyam vinā anyatra tattva jñānam tu vidyate
translated: The knowledge of reality exists nowhere else except in the human body.

analyzed: kadācid labhyate janma mānuṣyam puṇya sañcayāt  /
translated: Human birth is sometimes obtained through the accumulation of merit.

analyzed: sopānībhūta mokṣasya mānuṣyam janma durlabham
translated: Human birth is difficult to obtain, as it is the stepping stone to liberation.

original: mānuṣeṣu ca śaṃsanti siddhayaḥ syuḥ pradhānikāḥ // //
analyzed: mānuṣeṣu ca śaṃsanti siddhayaḥ syuḥ pradhānikāḥ
translated: Among humans, they praise the principal accomplishments.

analyzed: aṇima ādi guṇa upetāḥ tasmāt devaḥ narottamaḥ
translated: Endowed with the qualities of becoming atomic and so on, therefore, the best of men is a god.

original: vinā dehena kasyāpi puruṣārtho na labhyate // //
analyzed: vinā dehena kasya api puruṣa arthaḥ na labhyate
translated: Without a body, no one can attain the human goal.

analyzed: tasmāt śarīram saṃrakṣya nityam jñānam prasādhaya
translated: Therefore, protecting the body, always accomplish knowledge.

analyzed: mānuṣam jñāna nikaram jñāna ātmānam param viduḥ
translated: The multitude of human knowledge, they know the supreme self as knowledge.

analyzed: munayaḥ mauna śīlāḥ ca muni tantra ādi gocaram
translated: The sages are of silent nature, the domain of the sage's scriptures and so on.

analyzed: mānuṣaḥ sarva gāmī ca nitya sthāna nirākulaḥ
translated: The human is all-pervading, always abiding in the place free from agitation.
Having performed the mantra recitation of friendship and the mantra recitation of yoga, preventing sin,

analyzed: param mokṣam avāpnoti mānuṣaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: The human attains the supreme liberation, there is no doubt about this.

original: mayoktāni ca tantrāṇi madbhaktā ye paṭhanti ca /
analyzed: mayā uktāni ca tantrāṇi mad bhaktāḥ ye paṭhanti ca
translated: Those devotees of mine who recite the scriptures taught by me,

analyzed: paṭhitvā kurute karma kṛtvā mad sannidhim vrajet
translated: Having recited, perform the ritual, having performed, they come into my presence.

original: maduktāni ca śāstrāṇi na jñātvā sādhako yadi /
analyzed: mad uktāni ca śāstrāṇi na jñātvā sādhakaḥ yadi
translated: If the practitioner does not know the scriptures taught by me,

analyzed: anya śāstrāṇi sambodhya koṭi varṣeṇa siddhi ati
translated: Having studied other scriptures, he attains success after ten million years.

analyzed: śuktau rajata vibhrāntiḥ yathā bhavati bhairava
translated: Just as the illusion of silver arises in a shell, O Bhairava,

analyzed: tathā anya darśanebhyaḥ ca bhuktim muktim ca kāṅkṣati
translated: In the same way, desiring enjoyment and liberation from other teachings.

original: yatra bhogastatra mokṣo dvayaṃ kutra na siddhyati /
analyzed: yatra bhogaḥ tatra mokṣaḥ dvayam kutra na siddhi ati
translated: Where there is enjoyment, there is liberation. Where is the pair not accomplished?

original: mama śrīpādukāmbhoje sevako mokṣabhogagaḥ // //🔽bāhyadraṣṭā pragṛhṇāti ākāśasthitatejasam /
analyzed: mama śrī pādukā ambhoje sevakaḥ mokṣa bhoga gaḥ  bāhyadraṣṭā pragṛhṇāti ākāśa sthita tejasam
translated: The servant who serves my lotus feet attains liberation and enjoyment.🔽The external seer grasps the light situated in space.

original: brahmāṇḍajñānadraṣṭā ca deśāṇḍasthaṃ prapaśyati // //🔽ghaṭapratyakṣasamaye āloko vyañjako yathā /
analyzed: brahmāṇḍa jñāna draṣṭā ca deśa aṇḍa stham prapaśyati  ghaṭa pratyakṣa samaye ālokaḥ vyañjakaḥ yathā
translated: The seer of the knowledge of the universe sees it situated in the world-egg.🔽Just as light is the revealer when a pot is directly perceived,

original: binā ghaṭattvayogena na pratyakṣo yathā ghaṭaḥ // //🔽itarād bhidyamāno'pi na bhedamupagacchati /
analyzed: binā ghaṭa tva yogena na pratyakṣaḥ yathā ghaṭaḥ  itarāt bhidyamānaḥ api na bhedam upagacchati
translated: the pot is not directly perceived without the connection of pot-ness.🔽Even though it is distinguished from others, it does not admit difference.

original: puruṣe naiva bhedo'sti vinā śaktiṃ kathañcana // //
analyzed: puruṣe nā eva bhedaḥ usti vinā śaktim kathañcana
translated: There is no difference in the soul in any way without power.

analyzed: śakti hīnaḥ yathā dehī nirbalaḥ
translated: Just as a powerless embodied being devoid of yoga,

analyzed: jñāna hīnaḥ tathā ātmānam na paśyati pada dvayam
translated: so one devoid of knowledge does not see the two-fold state.

analyzed: svabhāvam na adhigacchanti saṃsāra jñāna mohitāḥ
translated: Those deluded by the knowledge of worldly existence do not attain their own nature.

original: abhipaśyati saśloko yadbhāvaṃ paribhāvyate // //🔽īśvarasyāpi dūtasya yamarājasya bandhanam /
analyzed: abhipaśyati sa ślokaḥ yad bhāvam paribhāvyate  īśvarasya api dūtasya yama rājasya bandhanam
translated: The one with verses sees the state that is contemplated.🔽Even the messenger of the Lord, the king of Yama, goes to bondage and death,

original: nidhanaṃ cānugacchanti dṛṣṭvā ca tanujaṃ dhanam // //
analyzed: nidhanam ca anugacchanti dṛṣṭvā ca tanu jam dhanam
translated: having seen the wealth and body of his son.

original: loko mohasurāṃ pīttvā na vetti hitamātmanaḥ /
analyzed: lokaḥ moha surām pīttvā na vetti hitam ātmanaḥ
translated: The world, having drunk the wine of delusion, does not know what is good for itself.

original: sampadaḥ svapnameva syād yauvanaṃ kusumopamam // //🔽taḍiccapalamāyuṣyaṃ kasyāpyajñānato dhṛtiḥ /
analyzed: sampadaḥ svapnam eva syāt yauvanam kusuma upamam  taḍit capalam āyuṣyam kasya api ajñānataḥ dhṛtiḥ
translated: Prosperity would be like a dream, and youth like a flower.🔽Life is as fleeting as lightning, and someone's patience is due to ignorance.

analyzed: śatam jīvati martyaḥ ca nidrā syāt ardha hāriṇī  ardham harati kāminyāḥ śakti buddhi pratāpinī
translated: A human being lives for a hundred years, but sleep takes away half of it.🔽Half is taken away by the wife, who robs one's energy, intellect, and vigor.

analyzed: asat vṛttiḥ ca mūḍhānām hanti āyuṣam ahani īśam
translated: And the bad conduct of the foolish destroys the great lord of life.

analyzed: bālya roga jarā duḥkhaiḥ sarvam tat api niṣphalam
translated: Even that is fruitless due to the suffering of childhood, disease, old age, and sorrow.

analyzed: strī putra pitṛ mātra ādi sambandhaḥ kena hetunā
translated: By what means is there a connection with wife, children, father, mother, and others?

original: duḥkhamūlo hi saṃsāraḥ sa yasyāsti sa duḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: duḥkha mūlaḥ hi saṃsāraḥ sa yasya asti sa duḥkhitaḥ
translated: For the world is the root of suffering, and he who has it is miserable.

analyzed: asya tyāgaḥ kṛtaḥ yena sa sukhī na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He who has renounced it is happy, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: sukha duḥkha parityāgī karmaṇā kim na labhyate
translated: By action, is not happiness attained by one who renounces both happiness and suffering?

analyzed: loka ācāra bhaya artham hi yaḥ karoti kriyā vidhim
translated: For one who performs the rites out of fear of worldly conduct and for the sake of the world,

analyzed: brahma jñātā aham akhile ye japanti nirādarāḥ
translated: Those who, out of disrespect, chant I am the knower of Brahman in all things,

analyzed: sāṃsārika sukha āsaktam brahma jñaḥ asmi iti vādinam
translated: One who is attached to worldly happiness and claims to be a knower of Brahman,

analyzed: tyajet tam satatam dhīraḥ cāṇḍālam iva dūratas
translated: The wise one should always abandon him from afar like an outcaste.

analyzed: gṛha araṇya samāloke gata vrīḍāḥ digambarāḥ
translated: They move about in the light of houses and forests, without shame, naked.

analyzed: caranti gardabha ādyāḥ ca vratinaḥ te bhavanti kim
translated: Do donkeys and others who observe vows become ascetics?

analyzed: tṛṇa parṇa udaka āhārāḥ satatam vana vāsinaḥ
translated: They subsist on grass, leaves, and water, always living in the forest.

analyzed: hariṇa ādi mṛgāḥ ca eva tāpasāḥ te bhavanti kim  śīta vāta ātapa sahāḥ bhakṣya abhakṣya samāḥ api
translated: Do deer and other animals become ascetics?🔽They endure cold, wind, and heat, and do not discriminate between what to eat and what not to eat.

analyzed: caranti śūkara ādyāḥ ca vratinaḥ te bhavanti kim
translated: Do pigs and others who observe vows become ascetics?

analyzed: ākāśe pakṣiṇaḥ sarve bhūta preta ādayaḥ api ca
translated: All birds in the sky, and all spirits, ghosts, and others,

analyzed: caranti rātri gāḥ sarve khecarāḥ kim maheśvarāḥ
translated: Do all those who move in the night and in the sky become great lords?

analyzed: ājanma maraṇa antam ca gaṅgā ādi taṭanī sthitāḥ
translated: Those who live on the banks of the Ganges from birth to death,

analyzed: maṇḍūka matsya pramukhāḥ vratinaḥ te bhavanti kim
translated: Do frogs, fish, and others who observe vows become ascetics?

analyzed: etad jñāna niviṣṭa aṅgāḥ yadi gacchanti paṇḍitāḥ
translated: If the wise ones with their bodies immersed in this knowledge go thus,

translated: still, due to the fault of their actions, they remain in hell.

analyzed: kauṭilya alasa saṃsarga vajītāḥ ye bhavanti hi
translated: Those who are free from the company of crooked and lazy people,

analyzed: prāpnuvanti mama sthānam mama bhakti parāyaṇāḥ
translated: who are devoted to my worship, attain my abode.

analyzed: ūdrdhvam vrajanti bhūtāni śarīram ativāhikam
translated: Beings go upwards, leaving behind their temporary bodies.

analyzed: nija deha abhiśāpena nānā rūpaḥ bhavet naraḥ
translated: A man may assume various forms due to the curse on his own body.

analyzed: śarīra jaiḥ karma doṣaiḥ yāti sthāvara tām naraḥ
translated: A man goes to the state of an immobile object due to the faults of actions born from the body.

analyzed: iha duścaritaiḥ kecid kecid pūrva kṛtaiḥ tathā
translated: Some here, due to misdeeds, and some due to what was done before,

analyzed: prāpnuvanti durātmānaḥ narāḥ rūpa viparyayam
translated: The wicked-souled men attain a change in form.

analyzed: guru pāda vihīnāḥ ye te naśyanti mama ājñayā
translated: Those who are devoid of the feet of the Guru, they perish by my command.

analyzed: guruḥ mūlam hi mantrāṇām guruḥ mūlam parantapaḥ

analyzed: guroḥ prasāda mātreṇa siddhiḥ eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: By the grace of the Guru alone, there is certainly success.

analyzed: aham guruḥ aham devaḥ mantra arthaḥ asmi na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: bhedakāḥ narakam yānti nānā śāstra artha vajītāḥ

analyzed: sarvāsām eva vidyānām dīkṣā mūlam yathā prabho

analyzed: guru mūla svatantrasya guruḥ ātmā na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The Guru is the root of the independent one, the Guru is the self, there is no doubt.

analyzed: ātmā eva hi ātmanaḥ bandhuḥ ātmā eva ripuḥ ātmanaḥ
translated: The self is indeed the friend of the self, the self is indeed the enemy of the self.

analyzed: ātmanā kriyate karma bhāva siddhiḥ tadā bhavet
translated: An action is done by the self, then the accomplishment of the state would be.

analyzed: hīna aṅgī kapaṭī rogī bahu āśī śīlavajītaḥ
translated: One with incomplete limbs, a deceiver, a sick person, one who eats much, one devoid of good conduct,

analyzed: mayi upāsanam āsthāya upavidyām sadā abhyaset
translated: One should always practice the subsidiary lore, relying on the worship of me.

analyzed: dhanam dhānyam sutam vittam rājyam brāhmaṇa bhojanam
translated: Wealth, grain, sons, riches, kingdom, and feeding Brahmins,

translated: Should be employed for auspicious purposes, other thoughts are fruitless.🔽A man devoted to daily ancestral rites, of virtuous character, best among men,
A lord of the earth, of endearing conduct, intent on wandering to sacred seats,

analyzed: pīṭhe pīṭhe mahāvidyā darśanam yadi labhyate
translated: If he obtains the vision of the great knowledge at each sacred seat,

analyzed: tadā tasya kare sarvāḥ siddhayaḥ vyakta maṇḍalāḥ
translated: Then all the accomplishments, the unmanifest circles, are in his hand.

analyzed: akasmāt jāyate siddhiḥ mahāmāyā prasādataḥ
translated: Accomplishment arises suddenly through the grace of the great illusion.

analyzed: mahā vīraḥ mahā dhīraḥ divya bhāva sthitaḥ api vā
translated: The great hero, the greatly resolute one, or one abiding in divine nature,

analyzed: athavā paśu bhāva sthaḥ mantra pīṭham vivāsayet
translated: Or one abiding in the nature of an animal, should install the sacred seat of mantra.

analyzed: kriyāyāḥ phala dam proktam bhāva traya manoramam
translated: The fruit-giving of the rite, delightful to the three states of being, is declared.

analyzed: tathā ca yuga bhāvena divya vīreṇa bhairava
translated: And likewise, O Bhairava, by the divine hero in the age of Dvāpara,

analyzed: prapaśyanti mahā vīrāḥ paśavaḥ hīna jātayaḥ
translated: The great heroes see, while the animals, the inferior species,

analyzed: na paśyanti kali yuge śāstra abhibhūta cetasaḥ
translated: Do not see in the age of Kali, their minds overwhelmed by the scriptures.

analyzed: api varṣa sahasreṇa śāstra antam na eva gacchati
translated: Even in a thousand years, one does not reach the end of the scriptures.

analyzed: tarka ādi aneka śāstrāṇi alpa āyu vīghna koṭayaḥ
translated: The various scriptures beginning with logic are obstacles to the short lifespan of many.

original: tasmāt sāraṃ vijānīyāt kṣīraṃ haṃsa ivāmbhasi /
analyzed: tasmāt sāram vijānīyāt kṣīram haṃsaḥ iva ambhasi
translated: Therefore, one should know the essence, like a swan in water,

analyzed: kalau ca divya vīrābhyām nityam tad gata cetasaḥ
translated: And in the Kali Yuga, with divine and heroic conduct, always with the mind fixed on that,

analyzed: mahā bhaktāḥ prapaśyanti mahāvidyā param padam
translated: The great devotees see the supreme state of the great knowledge.

analyzed: sādhavaḥ mauna śīlāḥ ca sadā sādhana tatparāḥ
translated: The virtuous ones, of silent conduct, always devoted to spiritual practices,

analyzed: divya vīra svabhāvena paśyanti mad pada ambujam
translated: See my lotus feet with the nature of divine and heroic conduct.

analyzed: bhāva dvayam brāhmaṇānām mahā sat phala kāṅkṣiṇām
translated: The two states are for the Brahmins who desire the great fruit of true knowledge,

analyzed: athavā ca avadhūtānām bhāva dvayam udāhṛtam
translated: Or else, for those who are detached, the two states are mentioned.

analyzed: bhāva dvaya prabhāveṇa mahā yogī bhavet naraḥ
translated: By the power of the two states, a man becomes a great yogi.

analyzed: mūrkhaḥ api vākpatiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ bhāva dvaya prasādataḥ
translated: Even a fool becomes the best among eloquent ones by the grace of the two states.

analyzed: ye jānanti mahādeva mama tantra artha sādhanam
translated: Those who know the means of accomplishing the purpose of my Tantra, O Mahadeva,

original: bhāvadvayaṃ hi varṇānāṃ te rudrā nātra saṃśayaḥ /🔽bhāvuko bhaktiyogendraḥ sarvabhāvajñasādhanaḥ // //
analyzed: bhāva dvayam hi varṇānām te rudrāḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: They are Rudras among the castes, there is no doubt.🔽The devotee, the lord of devotion, the knower of all states, the means of accomplishment,

analyzed: unmatta jaḍa vat nityam nija tantra artha pāragaḥ
translated: Always like a madman or a dull person, the master of the meaning of his own Tantra.

original: vṛkṣo vahati puṣpāṇi gandhaṃ jānāti nāsikā // //
analyzed: vṛkṣaḥ vahati puṣpāṇi gandham jānāti nāsikā
translated: The tree bears flowers, but the nose knows the fragrance.

analyzed: paṭhanti sarva śāstrāṇi durlabhāḥ bhāva bodhakāḥ
translated: They recite all the scriptures, but those who awaken to the truth are rare.

analyzed: prrajñā hīnasya paṭhanam andhasya ādarśa darśanam
translated: For one devoid of wisdom, studying is like a blind man seeing a mirror.

analyzed: prajñāvataḥ dharmaśāstram bandhanāya upakalpate
translated: For one with wisdom, the Dharma scriptures serve as a bondage.

analyzed: tattvam īdṛś iti bhavet iti śāstra artha niścayaḥ
translated: The truth is of this kind - this is the ascertainment of the meaning of the scriptures.

analyzed: aham kartāham ātmā ca sarvavyāpī nirākulaḥ
translated: I am the doer, I am the self, all-pervading, free from anxiety,

analyzed: manasā iti svabhāvan ca cintayati api vākpatiḥ  saudāminī tejasaḥ vā sahasra varṣakam yadā
translated: The lord of speech also thinks of the mind and its nature.🔽When the greatly wise one sees for a thousand years the radiance of lightning,

analyzed: prapaśyati mahā jñānī eka candram sahasrakam
translated: As if a thousand moons,

analyzed: koṭi varṣa śatena api yat phalam labhate naraḥ
translated: The fruit that a man obtains even in a hundred million years,

analyzed: eka kṣaṇam aṅghirarajaḥ dhyātvā tad phalam aśnute
translated: By meditating on the dust of Anghira's feet for a single moment, he attains that fruit.

analyzed: vicaret yadi sarvatra kevala ānanda vardhanam
translated: If one wanders everywhere, enhancing only bliss,

analyzed: kāmarūpam mahāpīṭham trikoṇa ādhāra taijasam
translated: The great seat of Kamarupa, the triangular support of fire,

analyzed: jala budbuda śabda antam ananta maṅgala ātmakam
translated: The sound within the water bubble, the endless blissful self,

analyzed: sa bhavet mama dāsa indraḥ gaṇeśa guha vat priyaḥ
translated: He would be my chief servant, dear like Ganesha and Guha.

original: kaṃkālākhyāsāṭṭahāsāvikaṭākṣopapīṭhakam /🔽vicaret sādhakaśreṣṭho matpādābjaṃ yadīcchati // //🔽jvālāmukhīmahāpīṭhaṃ mama priyamatarkavit /
analyzed: vicaret sādhaka śreṣṭhaḥ mad pāda abjam yadi icchati  jvālāmukhī mahā pīṭham mama priyam a tarka vid
translated: The great adept who desires my lotus feet should roam the great seats of Kanakā, Ṭaṭṭahāsa, Vikaṭākṣa, and Upīṭha.

analyzed: yaḥ bhramet mama tuṣṭi artham sa yogī bhavati dhruvam
translated: The one who knows the truth, my dear, should roam the great seat of Jvālāmukhī for my satisfaction. He will surely become a yogi.

original: bhramanti ye sādhakendrāste siddhā nātra saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: bhramanti ye sādhaka indrāḥ te siddhāḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: The great adepts who roam the group of seats beginning with Jvālāmukhī, which is the collection of the two Bhavas, etc., are indeed accomplished, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: bhāvāt parataram nā asti trailokya siddhim icchatām
translated: For those who desire accomplishment in the three worlds, there is nothing higher than Bhava.

analyzed: prakāśita pada dvaya ambujam alakta koṭi prabham
translated: The lotus feet illuminated with the luster of a million lac dyes.
The remover of the world's fears, the bestower of worldly enjoyment and liberation,

original: guroḥ pādayugāmbujaṃ jayati yatra yoge jayam /
analyzed: guroḥ pāda yuga ambujam jayati yatra yoge jayam
translated: Where the pair of lotus feet of the Guru is victorious in yoga,

analyzed: bhajāmi paramam gurum nayana padma madhya sthita
translated: I worship the supreme Guru, residing in the middle of the lotus eyes,
The destroyer of the fear of the ocean of worldly existence, the disease of mental afflictions, and the decay of the body.

analyzed: prakāśita su paṅkaje mṛdula ṣoḍaśa ākhye prabhu
translated: On the soft, sixteen-petaled lotus, the two feet of the Lord, the two lotuses of the feet of the Guru,

analyzed: viśāla nayana ambuja dvaya taḍit prabhā maṇḍala
translated: I worship the supreme and inferior Guru, the bestower of all external enjoyments.🔽The one with the radiant halo of lightning from the two wide eyes,🔽The one with the dot of the crescent moon on the forehead,

analyzed: cala acala kalevaram pracapala dale dvādaśe
translated: The one with the moving and shaking body, in the twelfth leaf,

analyzed: mahā ojasam umāpate vīgata dakṣabhāge hṛdi
translated: In the heart, on the right side of the consort of Uma, of great prowess,

analyzed: prabhākara śata ujjvalam su vimala indu koṭi ānana
translated: The one shining with the brilliance of a hundred suns, with a face like a crore of bright moons,

analyzed: bhajāmi parameṣṭhinam gurum atīva vāra ujjvalam
translated: I worship the supreme lord, the Guru, shining with the nectar of the Vedas.

analyzed: guru ādyam ca śubham madana nidahanam hema mañjarī sāra
translated: The auspicious beginning with the Guru, the burning of Madana, the essence of the golden garland,

analyzed: nānā śabda adbhuta āhlādita parijanāt cāru cakra tri bhaṅgam  nityam dhyāyet prabhāte aruṇa śata ghaṭā śobhanam yoga gamya
translated: The beautiful three-fold circle, with the attendants delighted by the wonderful bliss of various sounds,🔽The yogis should always meditate at dawn, the one shining like a hundred red-colored pots, the one accessible through yoga,

analyzed: nābhau padma iti kānte daśa dala maṇibhe bhāvyate yogibhiḥ yat
translated: The one visualized by the yogis in the extremely beautiful lotus of the navel, with ten petals and jewels.

analyzed: yā mātā maya dānava ādi sva bhujā nirvāṇa sīmāpure
translated: The one who is the mother in the abode of Maya, the one who is the limit of Nirvana,

analyzed: svādhiṣṭhāna niketane rasa dale vaikuṇṭha mūle mayā
translated: The one who is in the abode of Svādhiṣṭhāna, in the leaf of Rasa, at the root of Vaikuṇṭha, by me,

analyzed: janma uddhāra vikāra su prahariṇī veda prabhā bhāvyate
translated: The one who is the remover of the changes of birth, the one who is the destroyer of the great, the one who is visualized by the yogis as the light of the Vedas.

analyzed: yā bhāṣā ānana kuṇḍalī kula patha accha āma ābha śobhā karī  mūle padma catur dale kulavatī niḥśvāsa deśa āśritā
translated: The mother who generates the peace of the mind afflicted by Cupid, dear to Vishnu, and related to Shankara,🔽She who is the coiled one at the mouth of speech, the bestower of the beauty of the path of Kula,🔽Residing at the root, in the four-petaled lotus of Kula, dependent on the region of exhalation,

analyzed: sākṣāt kāṅkṣita kalpavṛkṣa latikā sūdbhāṣayantī priyā
translated: The creeper of the wish-fulfilling tree, directly desired, speaking affectionately,

analyzed: nityā yogi bhaya apahā viṣa harā guru ambikā bhāvyate
translated: The eternal one, the remover of fear and poison of yogis, is contemplated upon as the mother of the Guru.

original: ūdrdhvāmbhoruhaniḥsṛtāmṛtaghaṭī mododvalāplāvitā /🔽gurvāsyā paripātu sūkṣmapathagā tejomayī bhāsvatī /
analyzed: ūdrdhva ambhoruha niḥsṛta amṛta ghaṭī moda udvala āplāvitā  guru āsyā paripātu sūkṣma patha gā tejaḥ mayī bhāsvatī
translated: Flowing from the lotus above, filled with nectar, flooded with the joy of abundance,🔽May the Guru's mouth protect, flowing through the subtle path, full of brilliance,

analyzed: sūkṣmā sādhana gocara amṛta mayī mūla ādi śīrṣa ambuje
translated: That subtle one, full of nectar, the object of practice, from the root to the lotus at the head,

analyzed: pūrṇā cetasi bhāvyate bhuvi kadā mātā sadā uddhru āmagā
translated: May the full one be contemplated upon in the mind, the mother who always flows upwards on the earth.

analyzed: sthiti pālana yogena dhyānena pūjanena vā
translated: By the yoga of preservation and protection, by meditation or worship,

analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet pratyaham vyāpya sa devaḥ na tu mānuṣaḥ  /

analyzed: kalyāṇam dhana dhānyam ca kītīm āyuḥ yaśaḥ śriyam
translated: Prosperity, wealth, grains, fame, longevity, glory, and fortune,

analyzed: sāyāhne ca prabhāte ca paṭhet yadi su buddhimān
translated: If a wise one recites this in the evening and morning,

analyzed: sa bhavet sādhaka śreṣṭhaḥ kalpadruma kalevaraḥ
translated: He will be the best of adepts, his body a wish-fulfilling tree.

analyzed: stavasya asya prasādena vāgīśa tvam avāpnuyāt
translated: By the grace of this hymn, one attains the state of being the lord of speech.

original: paśubhāvasthitā ye tu te'pi siddhāḥ na saṃśayaḥ /🔽ādau sādhakadevaśca sadācāramatiḥ sadā // //
analyzed: paśu bhāva sthitāḥ ye tu te pi siddhāḥ na saṃśayaḥ  ādau sādhaka devaḥ ca sat ācāra matiḥ sadā
translated: Even those who are in the state of being a mere disciple, they too are accomplished, there is no doubt.🔽First, the deity of the adept, always having the attitude of good conduct,

analyzed: paśu bhāvaḥ tatas vīraḥ sāyāhne divya bhāvavān
translated: then the hero in the state of being a mere disciple, in the evening having the divine state,

translated: of pure conduct, well-established, pure, skillful, of good understanding,🔽belonging to an order, devoted to meditation, skilled in mantra and tantra,

analyzed: nigraha anugrahe śaktaḥ vaśī mantra artha jāpakaḥ
translated: capable of restraining and favoring, self-controlled, muttering the meaning of the mantra,

analyzed: nirogī nirahaṅkāraḥ vikāra rahitaḥ mahān
translated: free from disease, free from ego, free from change, great,

analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ vākpatiḥ śrīmān sadā yajña vidhāna kṛt
translated: learned, lord of speech, prosperous, always performing sacrifices,
accomplished in the preliminary rites, free from what is beneficial and harmful,

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃyuktaḥ mahā jana gaṇa ādṛtaḥ
translated: endowed with all characteristics, respected by the multitude,
having accomplished the final stage of pranayama and other practices, wise, silent, detached,

analyzed: tapasvī satya vādī ca sadā dhyāna parāyaṇaḥ
translated: an ascetic, truthful, always devoted to meditation,

analyzed: āgama artha viśiṣṭa jñaḥ nija dharma parāyaṇaḥ  avyakta liṅga cihna sthaḥ bhāvakaḥ bhadra dānavān
translated: One who is distinguished in the knowledge of the meaning of the scriptures, devoted to one's own duty,🔽Residing in an indistinct liṅga, a meditator, the benefactor of the demons,

analyzed: lakṣmīvān dhṛtimān nāthaḥ guruḥ iti abhidhīyate
translated: Possessing prosperity, fortitude, a lord, a guru, is so called.

analyzed: śiṣyaḥ tu tādṛśaḥ bhūt tvā sat gurum paryupāśrayet
translated: The disciple, having become such, should attend upon a good guru.

analyzed: varjayet ca para ānanda rahitam
translated: And should avoid a guru who is devoid of the bliss of others, devoid of form,

analyzed: kuṣṭhinam krūra karmāṇam ninditam rogiṇam gurum
translated: A leper, one of cruel deeds, one who is censured, one who is sick.

analyzed: aṣṭa prakāra kuṣṭhena galatkuṣṭhinam eva ca
translated: One who is afflicted with leprosy of eight types, one who is leprous,

original: śvitriṇaṃ janahiṃsārthaṃ sadārthagrāhiṇaṃ tathā // //🔽svarṇavikrayiṇaṃ cauraṃ buddhihīnaṃ sukharvakam /
analyzed: śvitriṇam jana hiṃsā artham sadā artha grāhiṇam tathā  svarṇa vikrayiṇam cauram buddhi hīnam sukharvakam
translated: One who has white leprosy, one who harms people, one who takes money for the sake of others,🔽One who sells gold, a thief, one who is devoid of intelligence, one who is very thin,

analyzed: śyāva dantam kula ācāra rahitam
translated: One who has black teeth, one who is devoid of family conduct, one who is devoid of peace,

analyzed: sa kalaṅkam netra rogaiḥ pīḍitam para dāra gam
translated: One who has blemishes, one who is afflicted with eye diseases, one who has intercourse with others' wives,

original: asaṃskāraṃ pravaktāraṃ strījitaṃ cādhikāṅgakam // //🔽kapaṭātmānakaṃ hiṃsāviśiṣṭaṃ bahujalpakam /
analyzed: a saṃskāram pravaktāram strī jitam ca adhika aṅgakam  kapaṭa ātmānakam hiṃsā viśiṣṭam bahu jalpakam
translated: One who is unrefined, one who speaks, one who is subdued by women, one who has extra limbs,🔽One whose soul is deceitful, one who is distinguished by violence, one who talks a lot,

analyzed: bahu āśinam hi kṛpaṇam mithyā vādinam eva ca
translated: One who eats a lot, one who is miserly, one who speaks falsely,

analyzed: aśāntam bhāva hīnam ca
translated: One who is not tranquil, one who is devoid of feelings, one who is devoid of the five conducts,

analyzed: doṣa jālaiḥ pūrita aṅgam pūjayet na gurum binā
translated: One should not worship a deity whose body is filled with faults without a guru.

analyzed: gurau mānuṣa buddhim tu mantreṣu lipi bhāvanam
translated: If one considers the guru to be a human being, the mantras to be mere writing,

analyzed: pratimāsu śilā rūpam vibhāvya narakam vrajet
translated: and the images to be made of stone, one will go to hell.

analyzed: janma hetū hi pitarau pūjanīyau prayatnataḥ
translated: The parents are the cause of birth and should be worshipped with effort.

analyzed: guruvī śeṣatas pūjyaḥ dharma adharma pradarśakaḥ
translated: The guru, who shows what is right and wrong, should be worshipped especially.

analyzed: guruḥ pitā guruḥ mātā guruḥ devaḥ guruḥ gatiḥ
translated: The guru is the father, the guru is the mother, the guru is the god, the guru is the refuge.

original: śive ruṣṭe gurustrātā gurau ruṣṭe na kaścana // //
analyzed: śive ruṣṭe guruḥ trātā gurau ruṣṭe na kaścana
translated: When Shiva is angry, the guru is the savior; when the guru is angry, no one is.

analyzed: prakartavyam vāc manaḥ kāya karmabhiḥ
translated: What has been taught by the guru should be done with speech, mind, and body.

original: ahitācaraṇād deva viṣṭhāyāṃ jāyate kṛmiḥ // //🔽mantratyāgād bhavenmṛtyurgurutyāgād daridratā /
analyzed: ahita ācaraṇāt deva viṣṭhāyām jāyate kṛmiḥ  mantra tyāgāt bhavet mṛtyuḥ guru tyāgāt daridra tā
translated: O God, by engaging in what is harmful, one is born as a worm in feces.🔽By abandoning the mantra, death occurs; by abandoning the guru, poverty occurs.

analyzed: guru mantra parityāgāt rauravam narakam vrajet
translated: By abandoning the guru and mantra, one goes to the Raurava hell.

analyzed: gurau sannihite yaḥ tu pūjayet anya devatām
translated: If one worships other deities while the guru is present,

original: prayāti narakaṃ ghoraṃ sā pūjā viphalā bhavet // //
analyzed: prayāti narakam ghoram sā pūjā viphalā bhavet
translated: that worship becomes fruitless and one goes to a terrible hell.

analyzed: guru vat guru putreṣu guru vat tad suta ādiṣu
translated: One should treat the guru's sons like the guru, and their sons and so on like the guru's sons.

original: avidyo vā savidyo vā gurureva tu daivatam // //
analyzed: avidyaḥ vā sa vidyaḥ vā guruḥ eva tu daivatam
translated: Whether ignorant or learned, the guru alone is the deity.

analyzed: amārga sthaḥ upi mārga sthaḥ guruḥ eva tu daivatam
translated: Even if he is not on the right path, the guru is indeed the deity.

analyzed: utpādaka brahma dātroḥ garīyān brahma daḥ guruḥ
translated: The guru who bestows the knowledge of Brahman is more venerable than the one who gives birth.

analyzed: tasmāt manyeta satatam pituḥ api adhikam gurum
translated: Therefore, one should always consider the guru to be superior even to the father.

analyzed: guru deva adhīnaḥ ca asmi śāstre mantre kulākule
translated: I am dependent on the guru and the deity in the scriptures, mantras, and family lineage.

analyzed: na adhikārī bhavet nātha śrī guroḥ pada bhāvakaḥ
translated: O Lord, one who does not honor the guru's feet is not qualified.

original: gururmātā pitā svāmī bāndhavaḥ suhṛt śivaḥ // //
analyzed: guruḥ mātā pitā svāmī bāndhavaḥ suhṛd śivaḥ  /
translated: The guru is the mother, father, master, relative, friend, and Shiva.

original: ityādhāya mano nityaṃ bhajet sarvātmanā gurum /
analyzed: iti ādhāya manaḥ nityam bhajet sarva ātmanā gurum
translated: Having thus always fixed the mind, one should worship the guru with one's whole being.

analyzed: ekam eva param brahma sthūla śukla maṇi prabham
translated: The one supreme Brahman, with the luster of a large white gem,

analyzed: sarva karma niyantāram gurum ātmānam āśrayet
translated: I take refuge in the guru, the controller of all actions, and the self.

original: guruśca sarvabhāvānāṃ bhāvamekaṃ na saṃśayaḥ // //🔽niḥsandigdhaṃ gurorvākyaṃ saṃśayātmā vinaśyati
analyzed: guruḥ ca sarva bhāvānām bhāvam ekam na saṃśayaḥ  niḥsandigdham guroḥ vākyam saṃśaya ātmā vinaśyati
translated: And the guru is undoubtedly the one reality of all existences.🔽The words of the guru are free from doubt; one with a doubting mind perishes.

analyzed: niḥsaṃśayī guru pade sarva tyāgī padam vrajet
translated: Free from doubt, the one who has renounced everything in the guru's feet, will attain the state.

analyzed: khecara tvam avāpnoti māsāt eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: One attains the ability to move in the sky in just one month, there is no doubt.

analyzed: sat gurum āśritam śiṣyam varṣam ekam pratīkṣayet  /
translated: One should wait for one year for the disciple who has taken refuge in the true guru.

original: saguṇaṃ nirguṇaṃ vāpi jñātvā mantraṃ pradāpayet /
analyzed: saguṇam nirguṇam vā api jñātvā mantram pradāpayet
translated: Having known the mantra with or without qualities, one should impart it.

analyzed: śiṣyasya lakṣaṇam sarvam śubha aśubha vivecanam
translated: All the characteristics of the disciple, the discrimination of good and bad,

analyzed: anyathā vipra doṣeṇa siddhi pūjā phalam dahet
translated: Otherwise, due to the fault of the Brahmin, the fruits of accomplishment and worship will be burnt.

original: kāmukaṃ kuṭilaṃ lokaninditaṃ satyavajītam // //🔽avinītamasamarthaṃ prajñāhīnaṃ ripupriyam /
analyzed: kāmukam kuṭilam loka ninditam satyavajītam  avinītam asamartham prajñā hīnam ripu priyam
translated: One who is lustful, crooked, condemned by the world, devoid of truth,🔽Uncultured, incapable, lacking in wisdom, fond of enemies,

analyzed: sadā pāpa kriyā yuktam vidyā śūnyam jaḍa ātmakam  kali doṣa samūha aṅgam
translated: Always engaged in sinful acts, devoid of knowledge, dull-witted,🔽Having the limbs of the mass of Kali's faults, devoid of Vedic rituals,

analyzed: āśrama ācāra hīnam ca aśuddha antaḥkaraṇa udyatam  sadā śraddhā virahitam adhairyam krodhinam bhramam
translated: Devoid of the conduct of the stages of life, with an impure inner mind,🔽Always devoid of faith, timid, angry, confused,

analyzed: asat caritram viguṇam para dāra āturam sadā
translated: Having an inauspicious conduct, of bad qualities, always afflicted by others' wives,

analyzed: asat buddhi samūha uttham abhaktam dvaita cetasam
translated: Arisen from a group of false ideas, unfaithful, having a dualistic mind,

original: nānānindāvṛtāṅgaṃ ca taṃ śiṣyaṃ varjayed guruḥ // //
analyzed: nānā nindā vṛta aṅgam ca tam śiṣyam varjayet guruḥ
translated: The teacher should avoid that disciple whose limbs are covered with various reproaches.

original: yadi na tyajyate vīra dhanādidānahetunā /🔽nārakī śiṣyavat pāpī tadviśiṣṭamavāpnuyāt // //
analyzed: yadi na tyajyate vīra dhana ādi dāna hetunā  nārakī śiṣya vat pāpī tad viśiṣṭam avāpnuyāt
translated: If, O hero, he is not abandoned due to the gift of wealth and so on,🔽The sinful one will go to hell like a disciple and attain even worse.

analyzed: kṣaṇāt asiddhaḥ sa bhavet śiṣya āsādita pātakaiḥ
translated: In a moment he would become unsuccessful due to the sins committed by the disciple.

analyzed: akasmāt narakam prāpya kārya nāśāya kevalam
translated: Having suddenly attained hell, only for the destruction of one's purpose.

analyzed: vicārya yatnāt vidhivat śiṣya saṃgraham ācaret
translated: Having carefully considered, one should perform the initiation of disciples according to the rules.

analyzed: anyathā śiṣya doṣeṇa naraka sthaḥ bhavet guruḥ
translated: Otherwise, due to the faults of the disciple, the teacher would be in hell.

original: na patnīṃ dīkṣayed bhartā na pitā dīkṣayet sutām /
analyzed: na patnīm dīkṣayet bhartā na pitā dīkṣayet sutām
translated: The husband should not initiate his wife, the father should not initiate his daughter,

original: na putraṃ ca tathā bhrātā bhrātaraṃ naiva dīkṣayet // //
analyzed: na putram ca tathā bhrātā bhrātaram na eva dīkṣayet
translated: nor should the brother initiate his brother or son.

original: siddhamantro yadi patistadā patnīṃ sa dīkṣayet /
analyzed: siddha mantraḥ yadi patiḥ tadā patnīm sa dīkṣayet
translated: If the husband has accomplished mantras, then he may initiate his wife.

original: śaktittvena bhairavastu na ca sā putrikā bhavet /
analyzed: bhairavaḥ tu na ca sā putrikā bhavet
translated: Bhairava is the power, but she should not be a disciple.

analyzed: mantrāṇām devatā jñeyā devatā guru rūpiṇī
translated: The deity of the mantras should be known as the guru in the form of the deity.

original: teṣāṃ bhedo na kartavyo yadīcchecchubhamātmanaḥ /🔽ekagrāme sthitaḥ śiṣyastrisandhyaṃ praṇamed gurum // //
analyzed: teṣām bhedaḥ na kartavyaḥ yadi icchet śubham ātmanaḥ  eka grāme sthitaḥ śiṣyaḥ trisandhyam praṇamet gurum
translated: Their distinction should not be made if one desires one's own good.🔽A disciple residing in the same village should bow to the guru three times a day.

analyzed: krośa mātra sthitaḥ bhaktyā gurum pratidinam namet
translated: Residing at a distance of one krośa, one should daily bow to the guru with devotion.

analyzed: ardha yojanataḥ śiṣyaḥ praṇamet pañca parvasu
translated: A disciple residing at half a yojana should bow on the five parvas.

analyzed: eka yojanam ārabhya yojana dvādaśa avadhiḥ
translated: Starting from one yojana up to twelve yojanas,

analyzed: dūra deśa sthitaḥ śiṣyaḥ bhaktyā tad sannidhim gataḥ
translated: a disciple residing in a distant country, having gone into his presence with devotion,🔽should bow to the guru with devotion, with faith and respect.
One should bow to the Guru for a month, reciting the number of Tantras and Yogas.

original: varṣaikeṇa bhaved yogyo vipro hi gurubhāvataḥ // //
analyzed: varṣa ekeṇa bhavet yogyaḥ vipraḥ hi guru bhāvataḥ
translated: Within a year, the Brahmin becomes fit to be a Guru.

analyzed: varṣa dvayena rājanyaḥ vaiśyaḥ tu vatsaraiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: Within two years, the Kshatriya, within three years, the Vaishya,

analyzed: catubhiḥ vatsaraiḥ śūdraḥ kathitā śiṣya yogya tā
translated: and within four years, the Shudra - thus the fitness of the disciple is described.

analyzed: yadi bhāgya vaśena eva siddha mantram labhet prabho
translated: If by the power of fate, one obtains a perfected Mantra, O Lord,

analyzed: mahāvidyā tri śaktyāḥ ca gṛhṇīyāt tad kulāt dhruvam
translated: One should certainly take the great Vidyas and the three Shaktis from that family.

analyzed: tatra eva saṃsthirā hṛṣṭā ca aham eva na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: etad bhāvam tvam karoṣi kasya hetoḥ tava priyā

analyzed: vāma aṅge saṃsthirā nityam
translated: Always residing in the left part of the body, free from desire and anger.

analyzed: ānandabhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Anandabhairava said:

translated: O Bhima, worshipped by the three worlds, having the form of Vagvadini,

analyzed: śava sādhana mātreṇa kena yogī bhavet vada

In the lotus face with the sweetness of the nectar of bliss and a gentle smile,

analyzed: yogī bhajati yoga artham kena tad phalam āvada
translated: The yogi worships for the sake of yoga. Tell me, what is the fruit of that?

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Anandabhairavi said:

translated: If you are a devotee of Shankara and devoted to my japa,

analyzed: tathā api śava bhāvena śava vat śava sādhanam

analyzed: rātri yoge prakarttavyam divase na kadācana
translated: The practice should be done at night, never during the day.

analyzed: śave sthiraḥ yaḥ babhūva sa bhaktaḥ me na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: me śava ākṛtimat dravyam mama tuṣṭi nibandhanam
translated: The substance in the form of my corpse is the cause of my satisfaction.

analyzed: mama ājñā pālane yogyaḥ kuryāt vīraḥ śavāsanam

analyzed: yadi aham tatra gacchāmi tadā eva sa śivaḥ bhavet

analyzed: niḥśeṣa tyāga mātreṇa śava tvam pralayam tanoḥ

analyzed: yaḥ karoti bhāva rāśim mayi devyām maheśvara
translated: O Mahesvara, he who creates a mass of existence in me, the goddess,

analyzed: trailokya pūjitāyām tu sa śivaḥ śavam āśrayet

analyzed: adhikārī tu bhaktasya pālanam para pṛṣṭhataḥ
translated: The devotee is entitled to protect others from behind.

analyzed: karomi kāminī nātha sandehaḥ na atra bhū tale
translated: O Lord of lovers, I do this. There is no doubt on this earth.

original: yadāhaṃ tyajyate gātraṃ paśūnāṃ māraṇāya ca /
analyzed: yadā aham tyajyate gātram paśūnām māraṇāya ca
translated: When my body is abandoned for the sake of killing animals,

analyzed: tadā ete ca mṛtāḥ sarve jīvante kena hetunā
translated: then all of them die. By what reason do they live?

analyzed: tad āhuti mahā dravyam śava indram raṇa hāni gam
translated: That great substance of oblation, the lord of corpses, the destroyer in battle,

original: ānīya sādhayedyastu sa sthiro me subhaktigaḥ // //
analyzed: ānīya sādhayet yaḥ tu sa sthiraḥ me su bhakti gaḥ
translated: he who brings it and accomplishes it, he is firm in my good devotion.

original: sadā krodhī bhavedyastu sa krūro nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: sadā krodhī bhavet yaḥ tu sa krūraḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He who is always angry is indeed cruel, there is no doubt about it.

original: sa kathaṃ vīrarātrau ca sādhayed vihvalaḥ śavam // //
analyzed: sa katham vīra rātrau ca sādhayet vihvalaḥ śavam
translated: How can he, being agitated, accomplish the corpse in the hero's night?

analyzed: bhaya vihvala cetāḥ yaḥ sa krodhī na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He whose mind is agitated by fear is indeed angry, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: na asti krodha samam pāpam pāpāt kṣiptaḥ bhavet śave
translated: There is no sin equal to anger. One thrown by sin becomes a corpse.

analyzed: yaḥ bhaktaḥ pāpa nirmuktaḥ siddha rūpī nirāśrayaḥ
translated: He who is a devotee, free from sin, of the form of a Siddha, without support,

analyzed: vivekī dhyāna niṣṭhaḥ ca sthiraḥ saṃsādhayet śavam
translated: The discerning one, devoted to meditation, and steadfast, should accomplish the corpse.

analyzed: yāvatkālam sthira cittam na prāpnoti jita indriyaḥ

translated: For that long, one should not even perform the means of the lord of corpses.🔽Having brought the corpse and dug it up with that very means,

original: taddanāttaddinaṃ yāvat yadbaddhvā vyāpya sādhayet // //🔽evaṃ kṛtvā haviṣyāśī mahāvidyādisādhanam /

translated: Having bound it and pervaded it with that, one should accomplish it for as long as that day.

analyzed: jita indriyaḥ mudā kuryāt aṣṭāṅga sādhanena ca
translated: Having done thus, one should joyfully perform the means of the great knowledge etc. with the eight-limbed practice, with controlled senses, and eating sacrificial food.

analyzed: tat aṣṭa aṅga phalam hi etat yat kṛttvā siddhi bhāj bhavet
translated: This is the fruit of the eight limbs, having done which one becomes a partaker of accomplishments.

analyzed: nāḍī mudrā bhedakam ca kula ācāra phala anvitam
translated: And it is endowed with the fruit of the Kula practice, which breaks the knots of the channels and mudras.

analyzed: aṣṭāṅga sādhanāt eva siddha rūpaḥ mahī tale
translated: By the practice of the eight limbs alone, one becomes of accomplished form on the earth.

original: paścādanyasvargagāmī bhavenna bhūtalaṃ binā // //🔽ādau bhūtalasiddhiḥsyādbhuvolokasya siddhibhāk /
analyzed: paścāt anya svarga gāmī bhavet na bhū talam binā  ādau bhū tala siddhiḥ syāt bhuvaḥ lokasya siddhi bhāj
translated: Afterwards, one goes to the other heaven, not without the earth.🔽First, there will be accomplishment on the earth, then one becomes a partaker of the accomplishment of the world of Bhūḥ.

analyzed: janalokasya siddhi īśaḥ tapolokasya siddhi bhāj
translated: One becomes the lord of the accomplishment of the world of Jana, and a partaker of the accomplishment of the world of Tapas.

analyzed: satyalokasya siddhīśaḥ paścāt bhavati sādhakaḥ
translated: Afterwards, the practitioner becomes the lord of the accomplishment of the world of Satya.

original: evaṃ krameṇa siddhiḥ syāt svargādīnāṃ maheśvara // //
analyzed: evam krameṇa siddhiḥ syāt svarga ādīnām maheśvara
translated: O Mahesvara, in this way, success in heaven and other things will be attained gradually.

analyzed: aṣṭāṅga sādhana arthāya devāḥ bhavanti bhū tale
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the eight-limbed path, the gods become manifest on earth.

analyzed: bhū tale siddhim āhṛtya gacchanti brahma mandire
translated: Having attained success on earth, they go to Brahma's abode.

analyzed: krameṇa evam vilīnāḥ te atas bhū tala sādhanam
translated: In this way, they gradually dissolve, therefore, the means of accomplishment is on earth.

analyzed: bhū tale śavam āsthāya brahmacārī divā śuciḥ
translated: On earth, one should rely on a corpse, celibate, pure during the day,

analyzed: niśāyām pañcatattvena divasa iṣṭa aṅga sādhanam
translated: at night, with the five principles, and during the day, the means of accomplishing the eight limbs.

analyzed: jita indriyaḥ vittavān aparaḥ naraḥ
translated: Another man who has conquered the senses, is self-controlled, wealthy,

analyzed: śavam saṃsādhayet dhīraḥ cintā ālasya vivajītaḥ  cintābhiḥ jāyate lobhaḥ lobhāt kāmaḥ prapadyate

analyzed: kāmāt bhavati sammohaḥ mohāt ālasya sañcayaḥ
translated: From desire, delusion arises, from delusion, a heap of laziness.

analyzed: ālasya doṣa jālena nidrā bhavati tad kṣaṇāt
translated: By the net of the faults of laziness, sleep arises at that very moment.

analyzed: tad krodhāt cittavikalaḥ vikalāt śvāsa varddhanaḥ

analyzed: vṛthā āyuḥ kṣayam āpnoti vistare śvāsa saṃkṣaye

analyzed: bala buddhi kṣayam yāti buddhi hīnaḥ jaḍa ātmakaḥ

analyzed: jaḍa bhāvena mantrāṇām japa hīnaḥ bhavet naraḥ

analyzed: samādhinā mahā jñānī sūryācandramasoḥ gatiḥ

translated: Having placed the mind in that wave, which is pure with the highest truth,🔽Having imagined the form of the lotus feet, one should meditate on it like a crore suns and moons.🔽The yogi should meditate on the form of the goddess, which is a crore times more fickle, brilliant, and pure,

analyzed: dhyāyet yogī sahasrāre koṭi sūrya indu mandirām
translated: In the abode of a crore suns and moons in the thousand-petaled lotus.
The goddess of knowledge, who is very beautiful, the queen of the heap of bliss of the three worlds,

analyzed: tejasi priya karīm yoga adarīm śāṅkarīm
translated: Who is dear to the brilliance of a crore times ten thousand suns, who is respected by yogis, and who is the daughter of Shankara,

analyzed: tām mālām sthira cañcalām guru ghanām vyāla acalām kevalām
translated: That garland, which is stable and unsteady, heavy and dense, and which is only a snake,

analyzed: dhyāyet sūkṣma samādhinā sthira matiḥ sa śrīpatiḥ gacchati
translated: One should meditate on it with subtle concentration, with a stable mind, and one goes to the abode of Shri.

analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmale uttara tantre mahā tantra uddīpane bhāva nirṇaye
translated: Thus in the Rudrayamala, in the northern Tantra, in the great Tantra Uddhipana,

translated: In the Pashava Kalpa, in the symbolic Shatchakra Sara, in the section on Yoga Vidyas,

analyzed: mantra siddhi śakti upāye bhairavī bhairava saṃvāde catuvīṃśaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: In the means of attaining Mantra Siddhi Shakti, in the dialogue between Bhairavi and Bhairava, the twenty-fourth chapter.

analyzed: atha pañcaviṃśaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Now, the twenty-fifth chapter.

analyzed: ānandabhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Anandabhirav said:

analyzed: vada kānte rahasyam me tattva avadhāna pūrvakam
translated: Tell me, beloved, the secret with full attention to reality,

analyzed: yat yat jñātvā mahā yogī praviśati anala ambuje
translated: Knowing which the great yogi enters the fire lotus.

analyzed: yadi sneha dṛṣṭiḥ asti mama brahma nirūpaṇam
translated: If there is a compassionate view, describe Brahman to me.

analyzed: yoga sāram tattva patham nirmalam vada yogine
translated: Tell the yogi the essence of yoga, the path of truth, which is pure.

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Anandabhirav said:

analyzed: śṛṇu prāṇeśa vakṣyāmi yoga nātha kriyā guro
translated: Listen, O lord of my life, I will tell you, O lord of yoga, O teacher of action,

analyzed: yoga aṅgam yoginām iṣṭam tattva brahma nirūpaṇam
translated: The yoga limb desired by yogis, the description of the true Brahman.

analyzed: etat sṛṣṭi prakārañca prapālana vidhim tathā
translated: This is the way of creation, and the method of preservation,

analyzed: asaṃkhya sṛṣṭi saṃhāram vadāmi tattvataḥ śṛṇu
translated: I shall tell you the truth about the creation and dissolution of innumerable things. Listen.

original: tvameva saṃhārakaro varapriyaḥ pradhānameṣu tritayeṣu śaṅkara /
analyzed: tvam eva saṃhāra karaḥ vara priyaḥ pradhānam eṣu tritayeṣu śaṅkara
translated: You alone are the destroyer, dear to the boon, the foremost among these three, O Śaṅkara.

analyzed: saṃhāra bhāvam mala bhūti nāśanam pradhānam ādyasya jagat prapālanam
translated: The state of dissolution, the destruction of the impurities, the foremost preservation of the world of the primordial one.

original: tatrādhanaṃ merubhujaṅgamaṅgaṃ sṛṣṭiprakāraṃ khalu tatra madhyamam /
analyzed: tatra adhanam meru bhujaṅgam aṅgam sṛṣṭi prakāram khalu tatra madhyamam
translated: There, the middle one is indeed the mode of creation of the wealth of the body of Meru and the serpent.

original: tatpālanañceti mayaiva rājye saṃhārarūpaṃ prakṛterguṇārthakam // //🔽etattrayaṃ nātha bhayādikāraṇaṃ tannāśanāmne praṇavaṃ guṇātmakam /
analyzed: tad pālanam ca iti mayā eva rājye saṃhāra rūpam prakṛteḥ guṇa arthakam  etat trayam nātha bhaya ādi kāraṇam tad nāśa nāmne praṇavam guṇa ātmakam
translated: That preservation and so on are in my own kingdom, the form of dissolution for the sake of the quality of Prakṛti.🔽This triad, O Lord, is the cause of fear and so on. For its destruction, I contemplate the syllable Om, which is of the nature of the qualities.

original: trayaṃ guṇātītamanantamakṣaraṃ sambhāvya yogī bhavatīha sādhakaḥ // //
analyzed: trayam guṇa atītam anantam akṣaram sambhāvya yogī bhavati iha sādhakaḥ
translated: The triad, which is beyond the qualities, is the endless syllable. The yogi who contemplates this becomes a successful practitioner here.

analyzed: avyakta rūpāt praṇavāt hi sṛṣṭiḥ tat līyate vyakta tanoḥ samāsā
translated: The creation is from the syllable Om, which is of the form of the unmanifest. It is included in the manifest body.

original: sūkṣmādyakārāt pratibhānti khe sadā praṇaśyati sthūlakalānnirakṣarāt // //
analyzed: sūkṣma ādi akārāt pratibhānti khe sadā praṇaśyati sthūla kalāt nirakṣarāt
translated: From the subtle letter a, the worlds always appear in the sky. It perishes from the gross letter na, which is without syllables.

original: atīva citraṃ jagatāṃ vicitraṃ nityaṃ caritraṃ kathituṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: atīva citram jagatām vicitram nityam caritram kathitum na śakyate
translated: The wonderful and diverse conduct of the worlds is extremely variegated. It cannot be described at all.

original: haṃsāśritāste bhavavāsino janā jñātvā na dehasthamupāśrayante // //
analyzed: haṃsa āśritāḥ te bhava vāsinaḥ janāḥ jñātvā na deha stham upāśrayante
translated: Those people who have resorted to the swan, the abode of existence, knowing that it is not the body, do not resort to it.

original: dehādhikārī praṇavādideva māyāśrito nidrita eṣa kālaḥ /
analyzed: deha adhikārī praṇava ādi deva māyā āśritaḥ nidritaḥ eṣa kālaḥ
translated: The lord of the body, the god beginning with Om, this time is dependent on Maya and is asleep.

original: pralīyate dīrghapathe ca kāle tadā praṇaśyanti jagat sthitā janāḥ // //🔽kālo jagadbhakṣaka īśaveśo tarī tu jīrṇā patihīnadīnā /
analyzed: pralīyate dīrghapathe ca kāle tadā praṇaśyanti jagat sthitāḥ janāḥ  kālaḥ jagat bhakṣakaḥ tarī tu jīrṇā pati hīna dīnā
translated: When it dissolves in the long path of time, then the people abiding in the world perish.🔽Time is the lord of the universe, the devourer of the world, the boat is worn out, helpless without a husband.

original: sa eva mṛtyuvīhitaṃ carācaraṃ prabhuñjati śrīrahitaṃ palāyanam // //
analyzed: saḥ eva mṛtyu vīhitam carācaram prabhuñjati śrīḥ rahitam palāyanam
translated: He himself enjoys the moving and unmoving world created by death, devoid of glory, fleeing.

analyzed: pañca indu tattvena mahendra sṛṣṭiḥ pratiṣṭhitā yajña vidhāna hetunā
translated: The creation of the great Indra is established by the principle of the five moons, for the purpose of the arrangement of sacrifices.

original: sadaiva yajñaṃ kurute bhavārṇave niḥsṛṣṭikāle varayajñasādhanam // //
analyzed: sadā eva yajñam kurute bhava arṇave niḥsṛṣṭi kāle vara yajña sādhanam
translated: He always performs the sacrifice, the means of the excellent sacrifice at the time of creation in the ocean of existence.

original: hitāhitaṃ tatra mahārṇave bhayaṃ vilokya lokā bhayavihvalāḥ sadā /
analyzed: hita ahitam tatra mahā arṇave bhayam vilokya lokāḥ bhaya vihvalāḥ sadā
translated: Seeing the fear of good and bad in that great ocean, people are always agitated by fear.

analyzed: viśanti te kutsita mārga maṇḍale atas mahānāraki buddhi hīnāḥ
translated: They enter the circle of the despised path, therefore they are devoid of the great hellish intellect.

original: māyāmaye dharmakulānale bhave līno hareryāti pathānusārī /
analyzed: māyā maye dharma kula anale bhave līnaḥ hareḥ yāti pathā anusārī
translated: In the fire of Dharma, which is full of Maya, he who is absorbed in Hari follows the path of Hari.

original: mirayeta kālānalatulyamṛtyunā kathaṃ tu yogī kathameva sādhakaḥ // //
analyzed: mirayeta kāla anala tulya mṛtyunā katham tu yogī katham eva sādhakaḥ
translated: How can a yogi or a practitioner be saved from death, which is like the fire of time?

original: yaḥ sādhakaḥ premakalāsubhaktyā sa eva mūrkho yadi yāti saṃsṛtau /
analyzed: yaḥ sādhakaḥ prema kalā su bhaktyā saḥ eva mūrkhaḥ yadi yāti saṃsṛtau
translated: If a practitioner, out of devotion to the art of love, becomes foolish and wanders in worldly existence,

analyzed: saṃsāra hīnaḥ priya cāru kālyāḥ siddhaḥ bhavet kāma da cakravartī
translated: He will be free from worldly existence and become a successful emperor of the desire realm, dear and beautiful.

analyzed: vaset na siddhaḥ gṛhīṇī samṛddhyām mahā vipad duḥkha viśoṣikāyām
translated: A successful person should not dwell in the prosperity of a householder, which dries up the great misery of misfortune.

original: yadīha kāle prakaroti vāsanāṃ tadā bhavenmṛtyuratīva niścitam // //
analyzed: yadi iha kāle prakaroti vāsanām tadā bhavet mṛtyuḥ atīva niścitam
translated: If he makes a desire here in this world, then death will certainly come.

original: kṛpāvalokyaṃ vadanāravindaṃ tadaiva he nātha mamaiva cedyadi /
analyzed: kṛpā avalokyam vadana aravindam tadā eva he nātha mama eva ced yadi
translated: If the lotus face, which is worthy of compassion, is only mine, O Lord,

original: sadaiva yaḥ sādhugaṇāśrito naro dhyātvā nigūḍhamatibhāgagadvataḥ // //
analyzed: sadā eva yaḥ sādhu gaṇa āśritaḥ naraḥ dhyātvā nigūḍha mati bhāga gadvataḥ
translated: Then a man who always relies on the assembly of the virtuous, meditating with a hidden mind full of devotion,

original: sa eva sādhuḥ prakṛterguṇāśritaḥ kṛtī vaśī vedapurāṇavaktā /
analyzed: saḥ eva sādhuḥ prakṛteḥ guṇa āśritaḥ kṛtī vaśī veda purāṇa vaktā
translated: He alone is virtuous, relying on the qualities of nature, successful, self-controlled, and a speaker of the Vedas and Puranas.

original: sattvaṃ mahākāla itīha cāhaṃ praṇiścayaṃ te kathitaṃ śriye mayā // //
analyzed: sattvam mahākālaḥ iti iha ca aham praṇiścayam te kathitam śriye mayā
translated: I am called Sattva and Mahakala here. I have told you this resolve for your glory.

analyzed: guṇena bhakta indra gaṇa adhikānām sākṣāt phalam yoga japa ākhya saṅgatim
translated: The direct result for those who are superior to the assembly of the best devotees through their qualities is the association called Yoga and Japa.

original: aṣṭāṅgabhedena śṛṇuṣva kāmaperamāya bhāvāya jayāya vakṣye // //
analyzed: aṣṭāṅga bhedena śṛṇuṣva bhāvāya jayāya vakṣye
translated: For the attainment of love, for the sake of existence, for victory, I shall speak.

original: māyādikaṃ yaḥ prathamaṃ vaśaṃ nayet sa eva yogī jagatāṃ pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: māyā ādikam yaḥ prathamam vaśam nayet saḥ eva yogī jagatām pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He who first brings under control the one beginning with illusion, he alone is the yogi, the support of the world.

analyzed: ravi prakāram yama vāsanā vaśe śṛṇuṣva tam kāla vaśa artha kevalam
translated: Listen to him, who is solely for the sake of time, under the control of the modifications of the sun and the impressions of Yama.

original: sarvatra kāmādikamāśu jitvā jetuṃ samartho yamakarmasādhakaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra kāma ādikam āśu jitvā jetum samarthaḥ yama karma sādhakaḥ
translated: Having quickly conquered desire and so on everywhere, he is able to conquer, accomplishing the deeds of Yama.

original: kāmaṃ tathā krodhamatīva lobhaṃ mohaṃ madaṃ mātsaritaṃ suduṣṭakṛtam // //
analyzed: kāmam tathā krodham atīva lobham moham madam mātsaritam su duṣṭa kṛtam
translated: Desire, anger, greed, delusion, pride, jealousy, and very wicked deeds.

original: ato mayā dvādaśa śabda ghātakaṃ vaśaṃ samākṛtya mahendratulyam /
analyzed: atas mayā dvādaśa śabda ghātakam vaśam samākṛtya mahā indra tulyam
translated: Therefore, having brought under control the twelve sounds that kill, equal to the great Indra,

original: sarvatra vāyorvaśakāraṇāya karoti yogī sacalānyathā bhavet // //🔽ahiṃsanaṃ satyasuvākyasupriyamasteyabhāvaṃ kurute vasiṣṭhavat /🔽subrahmacaryaṃ sudṛḍhārjjavaṃ sadā kṣamādhṛtiṃ sevasusūkṣmavāyunaḥ // //
analyzed: sarvatra vāyoḥ vaśa kāraṇāya karoti yogī sa calā anyathā bhavet  ahiṃsanam satya su vākya su priyam asteya bhāvam kurute vasiṣṭha vat  su brahmacaryam su dṛḍha ārjjavam sadā kṣamā dhṛtim seva su sūkṣma vāyunaḥ
translated: The yogi makes them move everywhere, for the sake of controlling the wind.🔽He practices non-violence, truth, good speech, kindness, and the state of not stealing, like Vasishtha.🔽He always practices celibacy, firm austerity, forgiveness, and patience, of the very subtle wind.

original: tathā mitāhāramasaṃśayaṃ manaḥ śaucaṃ prapañcārthavivarjanaṃ prabho /
analyzed: tathā mita āhāram asaṃśayam manaḥ śaucam prapañca artha vivarjanam prabho
translated: Likewise, he practices moderation in food, undoubtedly purity of mind, and renunciation of worldly things, O Lord.

analyzed: karoti yaḥ sādhaka cakravartī vādya utsava ajñāna vivarjanam sadā
translated: The one who is the emperor of practitioners always avoids the ignorance of musical festivals.

analyzed: vaśī yama dvādaśa saṃkhyayā iti karoti ca aṣṭāṅga phala artha sādhanam
translated: The one who is in control, with the number of twelve Yama, also performs the means of accomplishing the eight-fold fruit.

original: varānanā śrīcaraṇāravindaṃ sattvādaśācchannatrinetragocaram // //🔽tapaśca santoṣamanasthiraṃ sadā āstikyamevaṃ dvijadānapūjanam /
analyzed: varānanā śrī caraṇa aravindam  tapaḥ ca santoṣa manaḥ sthiram sadā āstikyam evam dvija dāna pūjanam
translated: The one with an excellent face, the lotus feet of Shri, the object of the three eyes hidden by the ten elements of existence.🔽Asceticism, contentment, always being unsteady, devotion, giving to Brahmins, worship,

analyzed: nitānta deva arcanam eva bhaktyā siddhānta śuddha śravaṇam ca hrīḥ matiḥ
translated: Intense worship of the deity with devotion, listening to the pure scriptures, modesty, intelligence.

original: japohutaṃ tarpaṇameva sevanaṃ tadbhāvanaṃ ceṣṭanameva nityam /
analyzed: japaḥ hutam tarpaṇam eva sevanam tad bhāvanam ceṣṭanam eva nityam
translated: Japa, oblation, offering libations, service, constant meditation and worship.

analyzed: iti iha śāstre niyamāḥ caturdaśā bhakti kriyā maṅgala sūcanāni
translated: Thus, in this scripture, there are fourteen observances, which are auspicious indications of devotional acts.

analyzed: pūrva ukta yoni āsanam eva satyam bheka āsanam baddha mahā utpala āsanam
translated: The previously mentioned postures are true, the frog posture, the great lotus posture,

analyzed: vīrāsanam bhadrasubhakāsanam ca pūrva uktam eva āsanam āśu kuryāt
translated: The hero posture, the auspicious and beautiful posture, one should quickly perform the previously mentioned posture.

original: sarvāṇi tantrāṇi kṛtāni nātha sūkṣmāṇi nālaṃ vaśahetunā mayā /
analyzed: sarvāṇi tantrāṇi kṛtāni nātha sūkṣmāṇi na alam vaśa hetunā mayā
translated: All the tantras have been composed by the Lord, but the subtle ones are not within the scope of my control.

original: tathāpi mūḍho yadi vāyupānamāhṛtya yonau bhramatīha pātakī // //
analyzed: tathā api mūḍhaḥ yadi vāyu pānam āhṛtya yonau bhramati iha pātakī
translated: Still, if a fool, having drunk air, wanders in the womb, he is a sinner.

analyzed: prāṇa anila ānanda vaśena mattaḥ gaja indra gāmī puruṣottamam smṛtam
translated: One who is intoxicated by the bliss of the vital air, and who moves like a lordly elephant, is known as Purushottama (the best of men).

original: tasyaiva sevānipuṇo bhavedvaśī brahmāṇḍalokaṃ paripāti yo balī // //
analyzed: tasya eva sevā nipuṇaḥ bhavet vaśī brahmāṇḍa lokam paripāti yaḥ balī
translated: He becomes skilled in serving him (the Lord), and the powerful one protects the world of the universe.

original: vadāmi devādisureśvara prabho sūkṣmānilaṃ prāṇavaśena dhārayet /
analyzed: vadāmi deva ādi sura īśvara prabho sūkṣma anilam prāṇa vaśena dhārayet
translated: I speak, O Lord of the gods and lords of the gods, one should control the subtle vital air by the power of the life force.

original: siddho bhavet sādhakacakravartī sarvāntarasthaṃ paripaśyati prabhum // //
analyzed: siddhaḥ bhavet sādhaka cakravartī sarva antara stham paripaśyati prabhum
translated: He becomes a Siddha, a Chakravartin of the practitioners, and sees the powerful Lord dwelling within all.

analyzed: ānandabhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Anandabhairava said:

analyzed: vada kānte mahā brahma jñānam sarvatra śobhanam
translated: Tell me, O beloved, the great Brahman knowledge, which is auspicious everywhere,

original: yena vāyuvaśaṃ kṛttvā khecaro bhūbhṛtāṃ patiḥ // //
analyzed: yena vāyu vaśam kṛttvā khecaraḥ bhūbhṛtām patiḥ
translated: By which, having brought the vital air under control, one becomes a sky-walker, the lord of the earth.

analyzed: sādhakaḥ brahma rūpī syāt brahma jñāna prasādataḥ
translated: The practitioner becomes Brahma-like by the grace of Brahman knowledge.

original: brahmajñānāt paraṃ jñānaṃ kutrāsti vada sundari // //
analyzed: brahma jñānāt param jñānam kutra asti vada sundari
translated: Where else is there a knowledge superior to Brahman knowledge? Tell me, O beautiful one.

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Anandabhairavi said:

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva yoginām nātha dharma jñaḥ brahma sañjñaka
translated: Listen, O lord of yogis, the knower of dharma, called Brahma,

analyzed: ajñāna dhvānta mohānām nirmalam brahma sādhanam
translated: The pure means of attaining Brahman, for the removal of ignorance, darkness, and delusion.

analyzed: brahma jñāna samaḥ dharmaḥ na anya dharmaḥ vidhīyate
translated: No other dharma is prescribed as equal to the knowledge of Brahman.

original: yadi brahmajñānadharmī sa siddho nātra saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: yadi brahma jñāna dharmī sa siddhaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: If one possesses the dharma of the knowledge of Brahman, he is certainly accomplished, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: koṭi kanyā pradānena koṭi jāpena kim phalam
translated: What is the fruit of giving away a crore of virgins, or reciting a crore times?

original: brahmajñānasamo dharmo nānyadharmo vidhīyate // //🔽sarovarasahasreṇa koṭihemācalena ca /
analyzed: brahma jñāna samaḥ dharmaḥ na anya dharmaḥ vidhīyate  sarovara sahasreṇa koṭi hema acalena ca
translated: No other dharma is prescribed as equal to the knowledge of Brahman.🔽What is the fruit of a thousand lakes, a crore of golden mountains,

analyzed: koṭi brāhmaṇa bhojyena koṭi tīrthena kim phalam
translated: a crore of Brahmins fed, or a crore of holy places?

analyzed: kāmarūpe mahā pīṭhe sādhakaiḥ labhyate yadi
translated: If it is obtained by adepts in the great seat of Kamarupa,

analyzed: brahma jñāna samaḥ dharmaḥ na anya dharmaḥ vidhīyate
translated: no other dharma is prescribed as equal to the knowledge of Brahman.

analyzed: brahma jñānam tu dvividham prāṇāyāma jam avyayam
translated: The knowledge of Brahman is of two kinds: that born of breath control and the imperishable.

analyzed: bhakti vākyam śabda rasam svarūpam brahmaṇaḥ patham
translated: The path of the essence of Brahman's form is the essence of devotion and speech.

analyzed: prāṇāyāmam tu dvividham sugarbham ca nigarbhakam
translated: Breath control is of two kinds: with a good embryo and without an embryo.

original: japadhyānaṃ sagarbhaṃ tu tadā yuktaṃ nigarbhakam // //
analyzed: japa dhyānam sa garbham tu tadā yuktam nigarbhakam
translated: Japa and meditation are with an embryo, then it is proper without an embryo.
Breath control, which is superior to the superior, is pervaded by the characteristics of the imperishable.

analyzed: brahma jñānena jānāti sādhakaḥ vijita indriyaḥ
translated: The adept who has conquered the senses knows it through the knowledge of Brahman.

analyzed: tad prakāra dvayam nātha mālāvṛttim japa kramam
translated: O Lord, those two types are the garland repetition and the method of japa.

analyzed: mālāvṛtti dvādaśakam japa kramam tu ṣoḍaśa
translated: The twelvefold garland repetition and the sixteenfold method of japa,

analyzed: nāsikāyām mahādeva lakṣaṇa trayam anuttamam
translated: O Mahadeva, in the nose, the three excellent characteristics,

analyzed: pūrakam kumbhakam tatra recakam devatā trayam
translated: The pūraka, kumbhaka, and recaka there, the three deities,

analyzed: eteṣām api adhiṣṭhāne brahma viṣṇu śivāḥ prajāḥ
translated: And in the foundation of these, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Śiva, the beings,

analyzed: triveṇī saṅgame yānti sarva pāpa apahārakāḥ
translated: Go to the confluence of the three rivers, which removes all sins.

original: īḍā ca bhāratī gaṅgā piṅgalā yamunā matā /
analyzed: īḍā ca bhāratī gaṅgā piṅgalā yamunā matā
translated: The Iḍā is the Ganges, and the Piṅgalā is considered the Yamunā.

analyzed: īḍā piṅgalayoḥ madhye suṣumnā ca sarasvatī
translated: Between the Iḍā and Piṅgalā, the Suṣumnā is the Sarasvatī.

analyzed: triveṇīsaṅgamaḥ yatra tīrtha rājaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: Where there is the confluence of the three rivers, that is said to be the king of holy places.

analyzed: triveṇī saṅgame vīraḥ cālayet tān punar punar
translated: The hero should repeatedly move them at the confluence of the three rivers.

analyzed: sarva pāpāt vinirmuktaḥ siddhaḥ bhavati na anyathā
translated: Freed from all sins, one becomes a siddha, not otherwise.

analyzed: punar punar bhrāmayitvā mahā tīrthe nirañjane
translated: Having whirled again and again in the great holy place, the stainless one,

original: vāyurūpaṃ mahādevaṃ siddho bhavati nānyathā /🔽candrasūryātmikāmadhye vahnirūpe mahojjvale // //
analyzed: vāyu rūpam mahādevam siddhaḥ bhavati na anyathā  candra sūrya ātmikā madhye vahni rūpe mahā ujjvale
translated: One becomes a siddha, not otherwise, the great god in the form of air.

analyzed: dhyātvā koṭira vikaram kuṇḍalī kiraṇam vaśī
translated: Having meditated on the radiant one in the form of fire in the middle consisting of the moon and sun, the one with a hundred rays, the powerful one,🔽In the middle of the moon and sun, the one with a hundred rays, the powerful one, the radiant one in the form of fire,

analyzed: tri vāra bhramaṇam vāyoḥ uttama adhama madhyamāḥ
translated: The best, medium and lowest are the three rotations of the wind.

original: yatra yatra gato vāyustatra tatra trayaṃ trayam /
analyzed: yatra yatra gataḥ vāyuḥ tatra tatra trayam trayam
translated: Wherever the wind goes, there are three, three.

original: iḍādevī ca candrākhyā sūryākhyā piṅgalā tathā // //
analyzed: iḍā devī ca candra ākhyā sūrya ākhyā piṅgalā tathā
translated: The goddess Ida is called Chandra, Pingala is called Surya,

analyzed: suṣumnā jananī mukhyā sūkṣmā paṅkaja tantu vat
translated: And Susumna is the chief mother, subtle like a lotus fiber.

original: suṣumnā madhyadeśe ca vajrākhyā nāḍikā śubhā // //
analyzed: suṣumnā madhya deśe ca vajra ākhyā nāḍikā śubhā
translated: In the middle region is the auspicious channel called Vajra,

original: tatra sūkṣmā citriṇī ca tatra śrīkuṇḍalīgatiḥ /
analyzed: tatra sūkṣmā citriṇī ca tatra śrīkuṇḍalī gatiḥ
translated: There is the subtle one and Citrini, there is the movement of Shri Kundalini.

original: tayā saṅgrāhya taṃ nāḍyā ṣaṭpadmaṃ sumanoharam // //
analyzed: tayā saṅgrāhya tam nāḍyā ṣaṭpadmam su manoharam
translated: By that, that channel should be grasped, the six lotuses are very charming.
The other knowledge that is to be attained by meditation is the six arrows united with Shakti.

analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca īśvaraḥ ca sadāśivaḥ
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Rudra, Ishvara, and Sadashiva,

analyzed: tatas paraśivaḥ nātha ṣaṣ śivāḥ parikītītāḥ
translated: Beyond that is Lord Parashiva, the six Shivas are proclaimed.

analyzed: ḍākinī rākiṇī śaktiḥ lākinī kākinī tathā
translated: Dakini, Rakini, Shakti, Laki, Kaki,

analyzed: sākinī tatra ṣaṭpadme śaktayaḥ ṣaṣ śiva anvitāḥ
translated: And Sakini, in those six lotuses are the six Shaktis united with the six Shivas.
The Muladhara, the Swadhisthana, the Manipura, the beautiful lotus,

analyzed: anāhatam viśuddha ākhyam ājñācakram mahotpalam
translated: The Anahata, the one called Vishuddha, the Ajna chakra, the great lotus.

analyzed: ājñācakra ādi madhye tu candram śītala tejasam
translated: In the middle of the cakra of the forehead, one should meditate on the moon of cool radiance,

analyzed: prapatantam mūla padme tam dhyātvā pūraka anilam
translated: falling into the root lotus, and then inhale the air.

analyzed: yāvatkālam sthairya guṇam tad kālam kumbhakam smṛtam
translated: As long as one can maintain stability, that is known as kumbhaka.

original: piṅgalāyāṃ pragacchantaṃ recakaṃ taṃ vaśaṃ nayet /🔽aṅguṣṭhaikaparvaṇā ca dakṣanāsāpuṭaṃ vaśī // //
analyzed: piṅgalāyām pragacchantam recakam tam vaśam nayet  aṅguṣṭha eka parvaṇā ca dakṣa nāsā puṭam vaśī
translated: One should control the exhalation that goes into the Pingala,🔽by closing the right nostril with the tip of the thumb.

analyzed: dhṛtvā ṣoḍaśa vāreṇa praṇavena japam caret
translated: One should perform japa with the praṇava mantra sixteen times.

analyzed: etat pūrakam ākṛtya kuryāt kumbhakam adbhutam
translated: Having done this inhalation, one should perform the wonderful kumbhaka.

analyzed: catuḥṣaṣṭi praṇavena japam dhyānam samācaret
translated: One should perform japa and meditation with the sixty-four praṇavas.

analyzed: kumbhaka anantaram nātha recakam kārayet budhaḥ  /
translated: O Lord, after kumbhaka, the wise one should perform recaka.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat vāra jāpena mūlena praṇavena vā
translated: With the root mantra or praṇava, one should perform japa thirty-two times.
Binding the two nostrils, kumbhaka bestows all accomplishments.

analyzed: kaniṣṭhā anāmikābhyām tu vāmam aṅguṣṭha dakṣiṇam  punar dakṣiṇa nāsāgera vāyum āpūrayet budhaḥ
translated: With the ring finger and little finger, one should close the left nostril and the thumb the right nostril.🔽The wise one should then inhale air through the right nostril.

analyzed: manu ṣoḍaśa jāpena kumbhayet pūrvavat tatas
translated: Then, as before, one should hold the breath with the praṇava mantra sixteen times.

analyzed: tatas vāme recakam ca dvātriṃśat praṇavena tu
translated: Then on the left, through the thirty-two Pranavas, and exhaling.

analyzed: punar vāmena sampūrya ṣoḍaśa praṇavena tu
translated: Again, filling with the left, through the sixteen Pranavas.

analyzed: punar dakṣiṇa nāsā agre dvādaśa aṅgula mānataḥ  /
translated: Again, at the tip of the right nostril, twelve finger-breadths away,

analyzed: kumbhayitvā recayet yaḥ sarvatra pūrvavat prabho
translated: and holding the breath, exhaling, everywhere as before, O Lord.
By these three Pranayamas, the best Pranayama is one.

analyzed: dvi vāram madhyamam proktam madhyamam ca eka vārakam
translated: Twice it is said to be medium, and the medium one is once.

analyzed: tri kālam kārayet yatnāt ananta phala siddhaye
translated: For the sake of attaining infinite fruits, one should perform it three times with effort.

analyzed: prātar madhyāhna kāle ca sāyahne niyataḥ śuciḥ
translated: In the morning, at midday, and in the evening, being restrained and pure,

analyzed: japa dhyāna ādibhiḥ mur yuktam sagarbham yaḥ karoti hi
translated: one who practices with Japa, meditation, etc., along with the fetus,

analyzed: māsāt sat lakṣaṇam prāpya ṣaṣ māse pavanāsanaḥ
translated: having attained the characteristics in a month, in six months, being seated on the wind,

analyzed: tālu mūle samāropya jihvā agram yoga siddhaye
translated: placing the tip of the tongue at the base of the palate for the sake of attaining Yoga,

analyzed: tri kāle siddhim āpnoti prāṇāyāmena ṣoḍaśa
translated: attains perfection at the three times by the sixteen Pranayamas.

analyzed: hṛdi mahārudrāya śakti yuktāya saṃvadet  /

analyzed: devatāyai namaḥ śabdam karanyāsam tatas caret
translated: One should perform the Nyāsa of the word Salutations to the Deity and then perform the Karanyāsa.

analyzed: tatas uṅganyāsam ākṛtya dhyānam kuryāt prayatnataḥ
translated: Then, having performed the Aṅganyāsa, one should perform meditation with effort.

analyzed: vahninā dīrghabījena mantrasya aṅgakriyām caret

analyzed: rudra dhyānam pravakṣyāmi dhyānāt bhavati bhūpatiḥ

analyzed: raudram raudra ātmakam tam prakṛti puruṣam gaṃbhīra gīta abhidhānam
translated: The fierce one, of a fierce nature, the Primordial Being, known as the Deep-voiced One,

original: śūlaṃ khaḍgaṃ dadhānaṃ varamabhayakaraṃ padmamekaṃ pracaṇḍam /🔽sañcāraṃ raśmijālaṃ śaśiśatakiraṇaṃ kāmadhenusvarūpaṃ /
analyzed: śūlam khaḍgam dadhānam varam abhaya karam padmam ekam pracaṇḍam  sañcāram raśmi jālam śaśi śata kiraṇam kāmadhenu svarūpam

analyzed: evam dhyātvā sumanasaiḥ ca sampūjya arghya vidhin caret

analyzed: kṛtvā arghyam rudra mantreṇa pīṭha pūjām samācaret

analyzed: vikaraṇī ākṣarā proktā bala ādi vikaraṇī atha
translated: Vikaraṇī (the first of the Karmas), and then Balā (the first of the Balis) are said to be the Aṣṭamātṛkās.

analyzed: balapramathanī paścāt sarvabhūtadamanī atha
translated: Then Balapramathani, Sarvabhutadamani,

translated: And Manonmani are said to be the seat-powers of Shiva.🔽One should worship the seat-powers in order with incense, flowers, etc.

analyzed: praṇava ādi namaḥ ntena pūjā kāryā vidhānataḥ
translated: The worship should be performed according to the rules, beginning with Om and ending with salutations.

analyzed: punar dhyātvā ca pādya arghyaiḥ āvāhya paripūjayet
translated: Having meditated again, one should invoke with water for washing the feet and worship.

analyzed: pādyam arghyam ācamanīyam snānīyam punar ācamanam

analyzed: gandha puṣpa bilva dalaiḥ pūrva āvaraṇam arcayet
translated: One should worship the first enclosure with incense, flowers, and bilva leaves.

analyzed: vaṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ ityādi ṣaṣ aṅga pūjanam
translated: The worship of the six limbs with vam hridaya-ayam namaḥ etc.,

analyzed: madhye catu dīkṣu ca evam śeṣe vāra dvayam vadet

analyzed: indra ādīn lokapālān ca pūjayitvā tatas ūrcayet  /
translated: Having worshipped Indra and the other Lokapalas, one should then worship.

analyzed: vajra ādīn ca mahākāla
translated: One should offer incense and lamps to Vajra and the other Mahakalas.

analyzed: naivedyam bahu kṛtvā ca pāna artham
translated: Having prepared many offerings, for drinking,

analyzed: śarīra śodhanam kṛtvā prāṇāyāmam tatas caret
translated: Having purified the body, one should then practice breath control.

analyzed: japet śata trayam mantrī viśuddhaḥ śuddha cetasā
translated: The pure mantra-reciting practitioner should recite three hundred times with a pure mind.

analyzed: aṣṭa uttaram yojayitvā gajāntaka sahasrakam
translated: Having multiplied by one hundred and eight, the thousand of the destroyer of the elephant,

analyzed: athavā aṣṭottaraśatam japtvā samarpaṇam caret  /
translated: Or having repeated one hundred and eight times, one should offer the oblations.
One should perform three breath control exercises for the success of one's own mantra.

analyzed: tatas praṇāmam ākuryāt śakti caitanya hetunā
translated: Then one should offer salutations for the sake of the consciousness of Shakti.

analyzed: namaḥ rudrāya devāya koṭi sūrrya indu mūrttaye
translated: Salutations to Lord Rudra, whose form is like a million suns and moons,

analyzed: sarvāya jñāna dānāya namaḥ te śūla dhāriṇe
translated: To the all-pervading one, the giver of knowledge, salutations to you, the wielder of the trident.

analyzed: namaḥ te kālarudrāya kālāya veda rūpiṇe
translated: Salutations to you, the Rudra of time, to time, the form of the Vedas,

analyzed: veda mārga pradarśāya śatru saṃkṣaya kāriṇe

analyzed: raudrāya śakti yuktāya śaṅkarāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the fierce one, to the one endowed with Shakti, to Shankara,

analyzed: catur bhujāya vedāya mahākāśa svarūpiṇe
translated: To the four-armed one, to the Veda, to the one whose form is the great sky,

analyzed: vara padma śūla khaḍga dhāriṇe brahmaṇe namaḥ
translated: To the one who holds a boon, a lotus, a trident, and a sword, salutations to Brahma.

analyzed: rudra śakti arcanam kṛtvā mahārudreṇa saṃyutam
translated: Having worshipped the Shakti of Rudra, united with Maharudra,

analyzed: maṇipūre dṛḍhaḥ yāti satyam satyam kula īśvara
translated: One firmly goes to the Manipura, it is true, true, O Lord of Kula.

analyzed: śakti arccana vidhim vakṣye mūlamantreṇa pūjanam
translated: I will describe the method of worshipping Shakti, the worship with the root mantra,

analyzed: sarvatra kārayet mantrī aṣṭa aiśvarya jayāya ca

analyzed: ādau ṛṣinyāsa kāryam vakṣyāmi śṛṇu tattvataḥ
translated: First, I will tell you about the assignment of the sages, listen to it truthfully.

analyzed: śirasi iha rudra śaktiḥ mahā viṣṇu padam tatas  ṛṣaye namaḥ uccārya mukhe hastam niyojayet  /

analyzed: paṅkta chandase namaḥ ca hṛdi hastam niyojayet
translated: Having uttered Salutations to the Paṅkti meter, one should place the hand on the heart.

analyzed: mahārudrāṇi iti padam lākinī padam eva ca
translated: The words Mahārudrāṇī and Lakini

analyzed: tri śakti ante mahāvidyā devatāyai namaḥ tatas

analyzed: sarva aṅge sakalāya eva vajrāya kīlakāya ca

analyzed: namaḥ padam samuccārya ṛṣi ādi nyāsam eva ca
translated: Having uttered the word Salutations, and the assignment of the sage and others,

analyzed: rudra śakti mahā ṣoḍhā nyāsam ca tad anantaram
translated: And then the assignment of the great embrace of Rudra's power,

analyzed: mantra nyāsam tatas kṛtvā vyāpaka nyāsam ācaret

analyzed: tāla trayam ca digbandhaḥ prāṇāyāmaḥ tatas param
translated: The three claps, binding the directions, and then the breath control,

analyzed: dhyānam kuryāt viśeṣeṇa rudra śaktyā mahā prabho

analyzed: rudrāṇīm rudra kāntām nava rasa jaḍitām kuṅkuma a śakta gātrām
