analyzed: lokeśīm ṣaṣ bhuja antām tribhuvana yajitām koṭi saudāminī bhām
translated: The mistress of the world, having six arms, worshipped in the three worlds, having the radiance of a million lightning bolts,

analyzed: padma sthām padma hastām vara bhaya karām khaḍga śaktim dadhānām

analyzed: dhyāyet raudrīm tri netrām śava damana śaśi śreṇi bhūṣā amala aṅgīm
translated: One should meditate on the fierce one, with three eyes, adorned with a garland of severed heads and the crescent moon.

analyzed: rudra vat pūjanam kāryam rudra śaktyāḥ ca śaṅkara
translated: The worship of Rudra and Rudra's Shakti should be done like Rudra, O Shankara.

analyzed: daśa upacāraiḥ pūjāḥ vā tathā pañca upacārakaiḥ

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa upacāraiḥ vā ṣoḍaśa ādi upacārakaiḥ
translated: Or with eighteen services, or with sixteen services and so on.

analyzed: alābhe tu prakarttavyam mānasena nivedayet

Having done three pranayama, having repeated one hundred and eight times,

translated: Or having repeatedly repeated a thousand times, along with one hundred and eight,

analyzed: vandanam bhakti yuktena kuryāt yoga ādi siddhaye

analyzed: mām rakṣa pālaya tvam hi maṇipūre namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Protect me, always guard me. Salutations again and again to Manipura.

analyzed: praṇamya vidhinā anena pūjā samāpanam caret  /

analyzed: punar tatra pūjayet vai prāsāda ākhyam mahā prabhum
translated: Again, there one should worship the great lord called Prasada.

analyzed: tathā mṛtyuñjayam devam maṇipūre prapūjayet

analyzed: pūrṇa udarī ādi sahitam kṛtvā pīṭham nyaset sudhīḥ

analyzed: pīṭha manum pravinyasya ṛṣi ādi nyāsam ācaret
translated: Having performed the Nyasa of the seat mantra, one should perform the Nyasa of the Rishi and other elements.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ asya vāsudevaḥ paṅktiḥ chandaḥ udāhṛtam
translated: The sage of this mantra is Vasudeva, the meter is said to be Paṅkti,

analyzed: sadāśivaḥ devatā ca aṅguli nyāsam ācaret

translated: Hāṃ to the thumbs, then Hrīṃ to the index fingers, and after that,

analyzed: evam kara nyāsam ākāryam vidhānena samācaret

analyzed: śūdraḥ tu etad paryantam kāryam homa ādikam ca yat
translated: A Śūdra should do everything up to this, and also the homa and other rites.

translated: One should not do this, O Lord of Pārvatī, nor should the world of women.

analyzed: yadi jñānī bhavet deva sa devaḥ na tu mānuṣaḥ  /
translated: If one becomes a knower, O God, then one is a god, not a human.

analyzed: cāṇḍāla ādīni vā jātau sthitaḥ brāhmaṇa uttamaḥ  jñānavān vāda saṃvāde vajītaḥ nyāsam ācaret
translated: Or if an excellent Brahmin is born in the caste of a Cāṇḍāla and others,🔽and is knowledgeable in debate, he should perform the nyāsa.

analyzed: nyāsaḥ tad maya tā buddhiḥ sa uhaṃbhāvena pūjayet
translated: Nyāsa is the identification of the mind with that, and one should worship with the feeling of I am that.

analyzed: saḥ eva jñānī paramaḥ veda śāstra viśāradaḥ
translated: He alone is the knower, the supreme one, skilled in the Vedas and scriptures.

analyzed: nyāsa pūjā ādikam tasya sarvadā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that for him, the nyāsa, worship, and so on are always (to be done).

analyzed: yāvat dehe hi aham buddhiḥ tāvat maraṇa dhārakaḥ
translated: As long as there is the notion of I in the body, for that long one holds on to death.

analyzed: mṛtyu jetā nyāsa pūjā ādikam kṛtaḥ
translated: Having conquered death through that, having performed the worship of the nyasa and other rites,

analyzed: ṣaṣ dīrgha bhājā bījena hakāreṇa sa bindunā
translated: With the seed syllable having six long vowels, the letter ha with a dot above it,

analyzed: karayoḥ aṃguli dvandvam vinyaset saṃkrameṇa tu

analyzed: īśāna ādyāḥ sādhaka uttamaḥ
translated: The best of adepts should perform the nyasa of the five forms beginning with Isha.

original: tataḥ kuryānmahādeva ūdrdhvaḥ prāgdakṣiṇottare /🔽mukheṣu vinyasenmantrī cāṅgulibhiḥ parasparam // //

translated: Then, O Mahadeva, one should place the hands above, to the east, south and north,🔽The reciter of mantras should place them on the faces, with the fingers touching each other.

analyzed: tad tad bījaiḥ prayatnena tad tad mūrttīḥ pravinyaset
translated: With effort, one should perform the nyasa of those forms with their respective seed syllables.

translated: On the two thumbs and the remaining parts, hau to Isha, Om salutations.

analyzed: ṣaṣ dīrgha bhājā bījena hakāreṇa sa bindunā  tatpuruṣam aghoram ca vāmadevam tatas param
translated: With the seed syllable having six long vowels, the letter ha with a dot above it,

original: sadyojātaṃ krameṇaiva aṅgulī dve tataḥ param /
analyzed: sadyojātam krameṇa eva aṅgulī dve tatas param
translated: Tatpurusha, Aghora, Vamadeva, and then Sadyojata, in sequence, on the two fingers.

analyzed: vinyaset sādhakaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ namaḥ ntam parameśvara
translated: The best of adepts should perform the nyasa ending with salutations to the supreme Lord.

analyzed: śiraḥ vadana hṛd guhya pādeṣu vinyaset sudhīḥ
translated: The wise one should perform the nyasa on the head, face, heart, genitals and feet.

analyzed: tad tad aṅgulibhiḥ ca eva tad krameṇa pravinyaset
translated: And with those respective fingers, one should perform the nyasa in that sequence.

analyzed: pañca mūrttīḥ nyaset nātha tad prakāram śṛṇuṣva tat
translated: O Lord, one should perform the nyasa of the five forms, listen to that method.

analyzed: īśāna ādi sva bījam tu prakāreṇa pravinyaset
translated: One should assign the seed-mantra of Isana etc. in the proper order.

analyzed: śūdraḥ kuryāt nyāsa jālam etat paryantam eva hi
translated: A Shudra should perform this entire net of Nyasa.

analyzed: tatas ūrdhva prāc dakṣiṇa paścima uttara saṃmukhe
translated: Then, facing east, south, west and north,

analyzed: īśānasya pañca kalāḥ brahma ṛc veda saṃyutāḥ
translated: Isana has five Kalas, along with Brahma, Rg Veda.

analyzed: pañca pāda ādikāḥ nātha praṇava ādi namaḥ ntikāḥ
translated: O Lord, beginning with the five feet, ending with Pranava and Namah,

original: īśānaṃ sarvavidyānāṃ oṃ nalinyai tataḥ param /
analyzed: īśānam sarva vidyānām om nalinyai tatas param
translated: Isana is the lord of all knowledge. Om, to the lotus, then after that,

original: kalāyai nama evāpi sarvatraivaṃ krameṇa tu // //
analyzed: kalāyai namaḥ eva api sarvatra evam krameṇa tu
translated: to Kala, and Namah everywhere, in this order.

original: īśvaraḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ tadaṅgaṃ padakaṃ tataḥ /🔽dayāyai kalāyai namaścāpi brahmādipadaṃ tataḥ // //
analyzed: īśvaraḥ sarva bhūtānām tad aṅgam padakam tatas  dayāyai kalāyai namaḥ ca api brahma ādi padam tatas
translated: The lord of all beings, then its limb, then the pada,🔽to Daya, to Kala, Namah, then the pada of Brahma etc.

analyzed: om brahma iṣṭa dāyai ca ante kalāyai namaḥ iti api
translated: Om, to the giver of desired things of Brahma, and at the end, to Kala, Namah.

analyzed: tatas me padam om sāvitryai padam vadet  kalāyai namaḥ evam hi sadāśivo pad antataḥ
translated: Then, may Shiva be to me, the pada, Om, say the pada of Savitri,🔽to Kala, Namah, thus, then the pada of Sadashiva,

analyzed: om ante ca aṃśumālinyai kalāyai pade iti api
translated: Om at the end, to Amsumalini, to Kala, the pada.

analyzed: diṅmukhe sa nyaset mantrī pūrva ādi krama yogataḥ
translated: The mantrin should assign it in the direction, in the order beginning with east.

original: tatpuruṣasya catasraḥ kalā nyaset sadā vaśī // //
analyzed: tatpuruṣasya catasraḥ kalāḥ nyaset sadā vaśī

analyzed: liṅga sthā acala putrikā nava gṛhe saṅkāmayantī śivā
translated: The auspicious one, residing in the immovable linga, enjoying with the son in the new house,

analyzed: me liṅga upari rudra nātha vipatha vyābhedanam saṅgamam
translated: O Lord Rudra, on top of my linga, may there be a union of the piercing of the path of the sky,

analyzed: śīghram kāraya devi mokṣaturikam koṭī iva candra ujjvalā
translated: O Goddess, quickly bring about the liberation of the army of crores, shining with the moon.

original: candrābhāsakalāśrayā śrayati yā śabdacchaṭā yā samā /
analyzed: candra ābhāsa kalā āśrayā śrayati yā śabda chaṭā yā samā
translated: The one who resorts to the digit of the moon, the one who is united with the flash of sound,

analyzed: māyā moha bhidā dayā dayati yā kṛṣṇa kriyā mohinī
translated: May the illusion, the delusion, the division, the compassion, which deludes the acts of Krishna,

translated: May Lakshmi, who is always before the spotless jewel of the dark-hued body, protect.

analyzed: śrīvidyā bhaya dāyinī tvam api sā me nābhi mūla udayā
translated: May the fearful Shri Vidya, which arises from the root of my navel, protect me.
The mother who is the abode of the mantra Vidya, who is the garland of the mudras, who is the abode of the mind,
Who is free from sleep, who is the abode of the cool wind and the sun,

analyzed: satya asatyāḥ vacana bhava gāḥ gauri mātā tvam eva
translated: Who is both true and untrue, who is born from speech, who is the mother Gauri,

analyzed: sthiti ānandā nayana sva cala ambhoja madhya prakāśā
translated: You are the bliss of existence, you shine in the middle of the moving lotus of the eye,

analyzed: nityam śraddhā gati patha karā kartrī kāma ana hartrī
translated: You always lead the path of faith, you are the giver of desires, you are the taker of desires,

analyzed: na ādya stotram bhaja bhaja bhaje tvām anantām sva rūpe
translated: I worship the first hymn, I worship you, the infinite one, in your own form.

analyzed: pīta apītā pavana gamanā dhāraṇa dhyāna yogā
translated: You are yellow and not yellow, you move through the wind, you are the yoga of concentration and meditation,

analyzed: kālā akālā kali kula kalā niṣkalā jñāna rūpā

You are the bliss of Krishna, you are the cave of desire, you are squinting, you are Shankari,

analyzed: tvam śrīghātrī dhavala kamalam nābhimūle pravakṣye
translated: You are the glorious-bodied one, I shall describe the white lotus at the navel.
White, with hundreds of white and reddish rays, the accomplishment of meditation and knowledge.

analyzed: prītā a prītā parama gahanā cāruṇām ānanāyāḥ
translated: Delighted and not delighted, extremely profound, with a reddish face.

original: tvaṃ sā vidyā vidhibudhavarā dhāraṇājñānagamyā /🔽ramyāramyā ramaṇaniratā nīradā pātu nābhim // //
analyzed: tvam sā vidyā vidhi budha varā dhāraṇā jñāna gamyā  ramyā aramyā ramaṇa niratā nīradā pātu nābhim
translated: You are that knowledge, the best among the wise, to be attained through the knowledge of meditation.🔽Delightful and not delightful, engaged in pleasing, may the cloud protect the navel.
Removing the thick creeper-like hair, not causing distress in the forest.

analyzed: kṣetra akṣetrā para cara gatā bhukti mukti prakāśā
translated: Beyond the field, gone to the realm of others, illuminating enjoyment and liberation.

analyzed: kaula akaula ājñāpita nayanā gañjanā vāta mugdhā
translated: With eyes directed by the Kaula and Kaula commands, swaying like a swing, intoxicated by the wind.

analyzed: mugdhā mugdhā mati dhanapateḥ nābhi saṃstheva nābhim
translated: Situated in the navel of the lord of great wealth, the charming and not charming one, protect the navel.

analyzed: haṃsī siṃhāsana gata padā cakra vidyā su sūkṣmā
translated: The swan, with feet on the lion throne, the extremely subtle wheel knowledge.

analyzed: śrīvidyā tvam nava vila carā sundarī rakta varṇā
translated: You are the glorious knowledge, moving in the nine cavities, beautiful, red-colored.

analyzed: svarṇa ambhoja upari cakra madhye pratiṣṭhā  sarvāḥ varṇā parijana dayā nābhi padmam ca rakṣā
translated: Established in the middle of the wheel, on a beautiful golden lotus,🔽All colors, compassionate towards servants, protect the lotus of the navel.

analyzed: brahmānandā nṛpa gaṇa mahā pūjayā śobhita aṅgī
translated: Adorned with the worship of the great assembly of kings, with the bliss of Brahman.

analyzed: śrī śrīvidyā sakala vibhavā bhāvanīyā mahā indraiḥ

analyzed: siddha sthāne maṇi maya gṛhe mūla siṃhāsana sthā

analyzed: padme ca aṣṭa anvita yuga dale nābhi mūle mamāva

analyzed: yoga jñānam dvividha vibhavam veda vidyā prakāśam
translated: The knowledge of Yoga, which is of two kinds, which illuminates the knowledge of the Vedas,

original: me cāṣṭāṅgaṃ samavatu mudā ṣoḍaśī bhairavasthā /

analyzed: candrolkā tvam bhava bhaya harā śoka tāpa apahantrī
translated: You are the light of the moon, the remover of the fear of worldly existence, the destroyer of the sorrow and heat,

analyzed: nābhau abje udayati suraḥ yaḥ tam īśe prarakṣa
translated: When the god rises in the lotus of the navel, O Lord, protect him.

original: saṃśiṣṭā tvaṃ virata karuṇe śītale śītaśaile /
analyzed: saṃśiṣṭā tvam virata karuṇe śītale śītaśaile
translated: You are the one who is instructed, O compassionate one, cool like the cool mountain,

analyzed: sākṣāt anya pracaya vacanā pārvaṇā parva pūrā
translated: The one who is directly called by others, full of the full moon,

analyzed: vidyut pūram sama sukha mayam pāhi pañca ānanā yā
translated: Protect the one who is full of lightning, full of equal happiness, the five-faced one.

original: tvaṃ sā devī śubhamaṇigṛhe śītalatvaṃ vidhehi // //
analyzed: tvam sā devī śubha maṇi gṛhe śītala tvam vidhehi
translated: You are that goddess, bring coolness to the auspicious gem-like house.

analyzed: chandogānām sakala viṣaya chedinī ca arṇa mātā
translated: The mother of the syllable, the destroyer of all objects of the Chandogas,

analyzed: mālā lākṣa ruṇa kiraṇa bhā gopa pūjyā giri ijyā
translated: The garland, red like lac, worshipped by the cowherds, worshipped by the mountain,

analyzed: jaya karāca aṅgirā ca anna pūrṇā

You are the one who bestows the joy of limbs with the rising of the moon, you have long hair, you are vast,

analyzed: tvam mātaṅgī janani jagatām bālikā vipracaṇḍā
translated: You are the tribal woman, O Mother, the young girl of the worlds, fierce to the Brahmins,

analyzed: jyotsnā jāle udayati sadā
translated: In the net of moonlight, you always rise with the radiance of red speech,

analyzed: sthiti anta sthā cala tanudharā dhāma sandhāmarā sā
translated: Residing at the end of sustenance, having a moving body, the abode of the abode of light,

analyzed: bodha ānanda prakṛti tanubhiḥ vyāpinī jñāna mugdhā
translated: Pervading with the nature of the bliss of consciousness, ignorant of knowledge,

analyzed: mātar tvam me maṇi dala gṛham pāhi sarva aṅga vidye

analyzed: vidyā caṇḍa amala sita sṛjā candana ālipta dehā

analyzed: viśveśāni bhagavati śive tvam kṣayā amogha rūpā

analyzed: jāyā śambhoḥ jaṭila śiva gatā mokṣa dā māna saṃsthā
translated: The wife of Shambhu, residing in the matted hair of Shiva, bestowing liberation, residing in the mind,

analyzed: cittam śubhram kuru viṣaya chedanam chedini tvam

analyzed: caraṇa tala vilagnam mām anātham pareśi

analyzed: mama maṇi kula padme nitya rūpa abhidhānam

analyzed: jayati khalu tadānīm stotra sāra prakāram

analyzed: bhavatu caraṇa padme lākinī devakanye

analyzed: viracaya manu śāstram siddha mantra prakāram
translated: Compose the treatise on Manu, the method of accomplished mantras.

analyzed: kamala vana samīpe vanya madhya iti guhye

analyzed: viṣaya viṣayi nāśam kaulike tvam vikṛtya

translated: In the terrible, thick darkness, you, the giver of the gift of my own family's sight, are pleased.

translated: You are the wish-fulfilling tree, the giver of virtue here, the sharer of the parts of the gift, without distinction.

analyzed: bhīmā bhītyā apahantrī hara pada nayanaḥ

analyzed: etat stotram paṭhet vidvān yoga jñānī nirāśrayaḥ

analyzed: mahā sukha gataḥ vīraḥ vibhavāya amṛtāya ca
translated: The hero, having attained great bliss, is for prosperity and immortality.

original: bhogamokṣau kare tasya caihike yogirāḍ bhavet /
analyzed: bhoga mokṣau kare tasya ca aihike yogi rāj bhavet
translated: For him, enjoyment and liberation are in his hand, and he becomes the king of yogis in this world.

analyzed: pare yāti mahādevī pāda padme na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: ehike cira jīvi tvam dadāti kāma dāyinī  maṇipūre sthitaḥ yāti kula mārga prasādataḥ

analyzed: tad layā maṇipūra sthā devatā paśyati dhruvam

analyzed: pūjā ante prapaṭhet stotram bhakti bhāva parāyaṇaḥ

analyzed: śīghram eva hi yogī syāt kula mārga prasādataḥ

analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmale uttara tantre lākinīśastavanam nāma ekonapañcāśattamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-ninth chapter named The Praise of Lakini by Rudra in the Uttara Tantra of Shri Rudrayamala.

analyzed: atha pañcāśattamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Now begins the fiftieth chapter.

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Anandabhairavi said:

analyzed: nātha kānta pravakṣyāmi siddha sādhanam uttamam
translated: O Lord, O Beloved, I will tell you the excellent means of accomplishment of the Siddhas,

analyzed: yena sādhana mātreṇa naraḥ yogī bhavet dhruvam

analyzed: trivīram trividham proktam uttama adhama madhyamam
translated: The Trivikrama is said to be of three kinds - superior, middling, and inferior.

analyzed: tatra eva trividham saṅgam ūrdhva pātāla bhū talam

original: sapta ūrdhvaṃ tathā nātha sapta bhūtalameva ca /

analyzed: sapta pātālam evam hi sapta tri sapta saṃkhyakam
translated: And seven in the nether world - thus, the enumeration is of twenty-one.

analyzed: tad madhye trividham bhāvam divya vīra paśu kramam  divi tiṣṭhanti devāḥ ca vīrāḥ tiṣṭhanti bhū tale
translated: Among them, the three kinds of existence are the divine, heroic, and animal stages.🔽The gods reside in heaven, the heroes reside on the earth,

translated: And the animals are in the nether world, in order, O Lord.

analyzed: sarvatra triguṇa channam sattva rajaḥ tama ādikam

analyzed: sattva guṇam svarga madhye sarve viṣṇu parāyaṇāḥ

analyzed: tadā sarve dṛḍhāḥ svarge bhū tale ca rajaḥ guṇam

analyzed: pātāle śiva sevāḥ ca śiva rūpiṇaḥ eva ca
translated: In the nether world, they serve Shiva and are indeed of the form of Shiva.

analyzed: tamaḥ guṇāt paśoḥ bhāvam tamaḥ dṛṣṭim samāpya ca
translated: Having attained the state of a paśu (animal) from the quality of tamas and the vision of tamas,

analyzed: tatas vihāya tat jñānam vīraḥ bhavati sādhakaḥ

analyzed: vīra bhāve jñāna dṛṣṭim brahma siddhim samāpya ca
translated: In the state of a hero, having attained the vision of knowledge and the perfection of Brahman,

analyzed: devatā bhavati kṣipram sattve nirmala bhāvake  sthiraḥ bhūtvā mahādevaḥ bhavati eva krameṇa tu
translated: he quickly becomes a deity in the pure state of sattva.🔽Having become stable, he gradually becomes a great god.

analyzed: ākāśa gāminī siddhiḥ kramaśas bhavati dhruvam
translated: The attainment of moving in the sky certainly occurs gradually.

analyzed: mūlādhārasya ca adhas vai pātāla tala vāsinaḥ
translated: Below the mūlādhāra, the inhabitants of the netherworlds,

analyzed: tad ūrdhve brahmaloke tu bhū tala ādi nivāsinaḥ

analyzed: tad ūrdhve sattva nilayam svādhiṣṭhānam hi daivatam

analyzed: vidhi vidyā prakāśaḥ ca varadevasya sampadam

analyzed: tad ūrdhve sarva rūpam ca sarva jñāna āśrayam param
translated: Above that, the all-form, the supreme abode of all knowledge,

analyzed: para sthānam mahādeva maṇipūram manoharam
translated: the great abode of Mahādeva, the charming maṇipūra,
the cakra consisting of Rudra's power, the circle of the cakra of Śrīvidyā,

analyzed: lākinī paramā māyā mahārudreṇa sevitā
translated: the supreme illusion of Lākini, served by the great Rudra,

analyzed: maṇipūra prakāśāya rudra śakti vībhāti ca
translated: shines with Rudra's power for the illumination of maṇipūra.
Full of the bliss of all knowledge, and the means of attaining all perfections.

analyzed: mahā sūkṣma śabda mayam kuṇḍalam jñāna sādhanam
translated: The ear-ring, which is the means of attaining knowledge, is full of the sound of the great subtle.

analyzed: yasyāḥ sādhana mātreṇa yogī bhavati bhairava
translated: By merely practicing it, the yogi becomes Bhairava, O Goddess.

analyzed: prakāraḥ eva sevāyām mahā siddhīśvaraḥ bhavet
translated: By this very method, one becomes the lord of great accomplishments in service.

analyzed: sarve ca paśavaḥ santi tala vat bhū tale narāḥ
translated: All the animals and men on the earth are like the palm tree.

analyzed: teṣām jñāna prakāśāya vīra bhāvaḥ prakāśitaḥ
translated: For the illumination of their knowledge, the heroic state is revealed.

analyzed: vīra bhāvam mudā prāpya krameṇa devatā bhavet  /
translated: Having joyfully attained the heroic state, one becomes the deity in due course.

analyzed: yad kāle vīra bhāva ādi siddhim prāpnoti mānavaḥ
translated: At the time when a man attains the accomplishment of the heroic state etc.,

analyzed: siddhiḥ māsena vākpatiḥ bhavet

analyzed: māsa trayeṇa saṃyogāt jāyate sura vallabhaḥ
translated: In three months, by union, one becomes the beloved of the gods.

analyzed: bālaḥ mṛtyuñjayasya prabhuḥ iti bhaya hā pātu me gupta deham
translated: The child, the lord of Mrityunjaya, may he, the protector of the hidden body, protect me.

original: kāmakrodhāpahantā janayati bharatān bhāratān pātu pṛthvīṃ /
analyzed: kāma krodha apahantā janayati bharatān bhāratān pātu pṛthvīm
translated: The remover of lust and anger, he generates the Bharatas and protects the earth.

original: yo yogī bhāvayogī mama kulaphaladaḥ sarvadā śaṃ karotu /
analyzed: yaḥ yogī bhāva yogī mama kula phala daḥ sarvadā śam karotu
translated: The yogi, the yogi of existence, may he always bestow the fruits of my family and do good.

analyzed: tad kroḍe loka cakram tila tula tulasī sannibham bhāti sūkṣmam
translated: On his lap, the world-wheel shines subtle, like a sesame seed or a basil leaf.

analyzed: tat śrī nātha aṅghra pāda dvayam ajaram aham bhāvaye hṛd prapañce
translated: I contemplate that pair of feet of Shri Natha, which is ageless, in the expanse of the heart.

analyzed: māyām mohe vivekī
translated: The discerning one, the cutter of the tail of the excellent demon Maya, the instigator in delusion,
The one who is the servant of the secret and gentle abode of the goddess, who is the great auspicious one,

original: lokātīto titīro jaya jaya karuṇānātha dātā tapasvī /
analyzed: titīraḥ jaya jaya karuṇā nātha dātā tapasvī
translated: Who is beyond the world, who is the savior, be victorious, be victorious, O lord of compassion, the giver, the ascetic,

original: mantroddhārārthaguptaṃ samavati ya iha prāṇanāthaṃ tamīḍe // //
analyzed: mantra uddhāra artha guptam samavati yaḥ iha prāṇanātham tam īḍe
translated: I praise him who is the protector of life here, who is hidden for the sake of extracting the essence of the mantra.

analyzed: bhāva antaḥ hṛdi
translated: The one who is the end of existence, who is extremely heavy, who is victorious in the lotus of the heart, who is the enemy of the immortal,

original: vāgdevī devatāyai nama iti manunā mohito vākpatīśaḥ /
analyzed: vāgdevī devatāyai namaḥ iti manunā mohitaḥ vākpati īśaḥ
translated: The lord of speech, who is deluded by the mantra Salutations to the goddess of speech,
The one who is surrounded by millions of victorious friends, who is the one who illuminates the meaning of the mantra,

original: bālārkānandaraśmipracayaśatamakhaḥ pātu māṃ duḥkhajālāt // //🔽hṛṣṭāṅgā saṅgatāṅgānanavimalaśikhākoṭibhirvajīto yo /
analyzed: bāla arka ānanda raśmi pracaya śata makhaḥ pātu mām duḥkha jālāt  hṛṣṭa aṅgā
translated: May he, who is the one with a hundred rays of the light of bliss of the rising sun, protect me from the net of suffering.🔽The one who is delighted, whose limbs are united, who is adorned with the tips of pure flames,

analyzed: mantrāt caitanya hartā praṇava maya śivam tad sadā ante śivam ca
translated: Who takes away the consciousness from the mantra, who is of the nature of pranava (Om), who is auspicious, and who is always at the end of Shiva,

original: dhyātvā māheśvarāyāṃ nama iti japanāt te mahendrādhipaḥ syāt /
analyzed: dhyātvā māheśvarāyām namaḥ iti japanāt te mahendra adhipaḥ syāt
translated: By meditating on him and reciting Salutations to the lord of Mahesha, one becomes the lord of the great Indra.

original: kālīputraḥ sa eva tvamabhayavaradaḥ sevyate yaiḥ sa muktaḥ // //
analyzed: kālī putraḥ saḥ eva tvam abhaya vara daḥ sevyate yaiḥ sa muktaḥ  /
translated: He is the son of Kali, he is the giver of fearlessness and boons, he is served by those who are liberated.

analyzed: haṃsaḥ prāṇa avihantā tvam akhila vara daḥ tvam nidānaḥ pradhānaḥ
translated: You are the swan, the killer of prana, you are the giver of all boons, you are the basis, the primary cause,

analyzed: śānti īśaḥ tvam pratiṣṭhaḥ praṇava śiva sadā bhadra māheśvarāya
translated: You are the lord of peace, the foundation, the Pranava Shiva, the ever auspicious Maheshvara.

analyzed: anta iti uccais namaḥ nte manum iha japate sampade doṣa bhaṅgā
translated: At the end, very loudly, with salutations at the end, he recites this mantra for prosperity and the destruction of faults.

original: dānandābdhau tvamīśo gururiha capalaṃ cāpalaṃ māṃ prapāhi // //
analyzed: dānanda abdhau tvam īśaḥ guruḥ iha capalam cāpalam mām prapāhi
translated: You are the lord in the ocean of giving, the guru here, protect me who is fickle and unsteady.

analyzed: ānanda udreka kārī tvam api sa karuṇā sāgaraḥ bhakti dātā
translated: You are the giver of the bliss of love, an ocean of compassion, the giver of devotion.

analyzed: dātā vidyādharīṇām tvam api suraripuḥ pārvatī prāṇanāthaḥ
translated: You are the giver of the vidyadharis, the enemy of the gods, the lord of Parvati's life.

analyzed: tāre bindu ādhara āḍhyam mantram eka akṣaram te
translated: The one-syllable mantra, enriched with the bindu below the syllable ta, along with the crescent moon,

original: tārāntaṃ tryakṣarantaṃ prajapati yadi yo yogirāḍ bhūtale syāt // //
analyzed: tāra antam tri akṣara antam prajapati yadi yaḥ yogi rāj bhū tale syāt
translated: If one recites the three-syllable mantra ending with ta on the earth, he would be the king of yogis.

analyzed: sarpa aṇḍa stham su siddhaḥ hara vidhum adharam candra bindu svarūpam
translated: The well-accomplished one, residing in the hood of the serpent, with the form of the crescent moon on Shiva's throat,

original: japtvā nityaṃ vilomaṃ praṇavamṛtiharaṃ vahnikāntā tadante /
analyzed: japtvā nityam vilomam praṇava mṛti haram vahnikāntā tad ante
translated: Reciting the reverse Pranava, the remover of death, at the end of the fire,

original: etadrūpaṃ padaṃ yo bhajati varagataṃ hemamañjīranādaṃ /
analyzed: etad rūpam padam yaḥ bhajati vara gatam hema mañjīra nādam
translated: He who worships this form, the supreme state, with the sound of golden anklets,

analyzed: mamrekṣa ānanda cittam vijaya vara kula ānanda daḥ prāṇa gam te
translated: With a mind full of the bliss of looking at me, the giver of the joy of the victorious and excellent Kula, residing in your life-force.

analyzed: uccāṭe mohane vā api ari vaśa samaye śānti puṣṭi ānta vaśye
translated: In exorcism, enchantment, or when under the power of an enemy, in pacification, nourishment, or complete subjugation,

original: te mantrān yojayitvā japati yadi sudhīḥ śrīpadābjāvalambī /
analyzed: te mantrān yojayitvā japati yadi sudhīḥ śrī pada abja avalambī
translated: If the wise one, relying on the lotus feet of Shri, combines the mantras and recites them,

original: sidhyet ṣaṭkarmasāraṃ paramagurugataḥ sa bhavet kalpaśākhī /
analyzed: sidhyet ṣaṭkarma sāram parama guru gataḥ sa bhavet kalpa śākhī
translated: He will accomplish the essence of the six acts, become a great guru, and a branch of the Kalpa tree.

original: rājendraḥ sarvaloke dhanapatisadṛśaḥ śambhunāthaprasādāt // //🔽khāntaṃ śakrādirūḍhaṃ vidhunayanayutaṃ kāmabījaṃ triśaktiṃ /
analyzed: rāja indraḥ sarva loke dhanapati sadṛśaḥ śambhunātha prasādāt  kha antam śakra ādi rūḍham vidhu nayana yutam kāmabījam triśaktim
translated: The lord of kings, like the lord of wealth in all worlds, by the grace of Lord Shambhu.🔽The mantra of Shiva, which is the earth element, mounted by Indra and others, united with the eyes of Vishnu, the seed of Kama, and the three powers,

analyzed: ca ādya inte om śivāya analavadhu militam yaḥ japet nātha mantram
translated: He who recites the lord's mantra at the beginning and end, with Om, united with the wife of the fire god,

analyzed: tena āmnāyaḥ japitvā kula patha nirataḥ sādhakaḥ śrī vareṇyaḥ
translated: Having recited that tradition, the adept, devoted to the path of Kula, the most excellent Shri,

original: kiṃ tasyāsādhyasiddhiṃ trijagati sa sukhī sanmukhī yogamārgī // //
analyzed: kim tasya asādhya siddhim trijagati sa sukhī sat mukhī yoga mārgī
translated: What is unattainable for him in the three worlds? He, being happy, is face to face with the path of Yoga.

analyzed: sarva atītaḥ vihārī pada gati rahitaḥ sarva gāmī virāmī
translated: Beyond all, enjoying, devoid of the gait of feet, going everywhere, transcending,
Without hands, the leader, the bestower of the best without limit, assuming all forms, assuming an ugly form,

analyzed: mantra jñaḥ tvam su mantrī maha maya samayaḥ saṃśaya asāra hantā
translated: You are the knower of mantras, an excellent minister, the essence of the time of the great, the destroyer of the essence of doubt,

original: mantā viśveśvarīṇāṃ parapaśupataye'nte namaḥ pātu namram // //
analyzed: mantā viśveśvarīṇām para paśupataye inte namaḥ pātu namram  /
translated: The thinker of the goddesses of the universe, at the end, salutations to the lord of the supreme beings. May salutations protect the humble one.

original: yogī bhogī virāgī tvamatulavibhavaḥ sambhavaḥ pañcacūḍo /🔽vāṇī śeṣaḥ priyeśaḥ śaśigrathitamṛḍāśobhitāṅgo hyanaṅgaḥ /🔽kāmo māyā rameśaḥ prathamadinakaraśreṇi śobhāvaliptaḥ /
analyzed: yogī bhogī virāgī tvam atula vibhavaḥ sambhavaḥ pañcacūḍo  vāṇī śeṣaḥ priyeśaḥ śaśi grathita mṛḍā śobhita aṅgaḥ hi anaṅgaḥ
translated: You are the yogi, the enjoyer, the detached one, the incomparable lord, the source of existence, the five-crested one,🔽The voice, the remaining one, the beloved lord, your body adorned with the moon and the pride of Shiva, you are the god of love,🔽You are desire, illusion, the lord of love, smeared with the beauty of the first row of rising suns,

analyzed: sarva aṅgam yaḥ prapāyāt amala kamala gaḥ krodha gaḥ
translated: You who are the embodiment of the pure white jasmine flower, the angry one, the one who bestows the boon of liberation,

analyzed: etat śrī śaṅkara stotram yaḥ paṭhet niyataḥ śuciḥ
translated: The one who recites this hymn to Lord Shankara with purity and restraint,
Will attain perfection in a year, which bestows all knowledge.

original: śucau vāpyaśucau stauti bhaktyā yaḥ sādhakottamaḥ /
analyzed: śucau vā api aśucau stauti bhaktyā yaḥ sādhaka uttamaḥ
translated: The best of practitioners who praises with devotion, whether pure or impure,

analyzed: sa sarva yātanā muktaḥ yogī granthi vibhedakaḥ
translated: Will be liberated from all torment, will be a yogi who breaks through the knots.

analyzed: akasmāt siddhim āpnoti prema ānanda su bhakti dām
translated: He suddenly attains perfection, which bestows love, bliss, and devotion,

analyzed: śatam aṣṭa uttaram ca asya puraścaryā vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: And is remembered as the method of one hundred and eight repetitions.

original: na snānaṃ na japaḥ kāryaṃ na pūjādividhānakam /
analyzed: na snānam na japaḥ kāryam na pūjā ādi vidhānakam
translated: There is no need for bathing, japa, or the performance of worship,

analyzed: kevalam stava pāṭhena anāhate susthiraḥ bhavet
translated: By simply reciting the hymn, one should remain very steady without distraction.
One who lives long, is free from attachment, and has transcended the worldly state,

original: paṭhitvā dhārayitvā ca yogabhraṣṭo na sambhavet /
analyzed: paṭhitvā dhārayitvā ca yoga bhraṣṭaḥ na sambhavet
translated: By reciting and retaining it, one does not fall from yoga.

analyzed: anāyāse yoga siddhim prāpnoti vipulām śriyam
translated: One attains the accomplishment of yoga without effort and abundant wealth.

original: iti śrīrudrayāmale uttaratantre mahātantroddīpane siddhamantraprakaraṇe ṣaṭcakraprakāśe
analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmale uttara tantre mahā tantra uddīpane siddha mantra prakaraṇe ṣaṭcakra prakāśe
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the six cakras in the Rudrayamala Uttara Tantra, in the Maha Tantra Uddhipana, in the section on accomplished mantras,

analyzed: bhairavī bhairava saṃvāde īśvarastotravinyāsaḥ nāma dviṣaṣṭitamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: in the dialogue between Bhairavi and Bhairava, the sixty-second chapter on the arrangement of the Isvara Stotra.

analyzed: atha triṣaṣṭitamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Now begins the sixty-third chapter.

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Anandabhairavi said:

analyzed: kavacam śṛṇu ca asya eva lokanātha śivāpate
translated: Listen to the Kavacha of this very Lord of the world, Lord of Shiva,

analyzed: īśvarasya param brahma nirvāṇa yoga dāyakam
translated: the supreme Brahman of the Lord, which bestows the yoga of liberation.

analyzed: kavacam durlabham loke nāma sammohanam param
translated: The Kavacha is rare in the world, the supreme deluder of names.

analyzed: kavacam dhyāna mātreṇa nirvāṇa phala bhāj bhavet
translated: By merely meditating on the Kavacha, one becomes a partaker of the fruit of liberation.

analyzed: asya kim putvatra māhātmyam tathā api tat vadāmi aham
translated: What is the greatness of reciting this? Still, I shall tell it.

analyzed: kevalam granthibhedāya nija deha anurakṣaṇāt
translated: Only for the sake of breaking the knots and protecting one's own body.

analyzed: sarveṣām api yoga indra devānām yoginām tathā
translated: For all the lords of yoga, the gods, and the yogis,

analyzed: bhāva ādi siddhi lābhāya kāya nirmala siddhaye
translated: for the attainment of the fruits of siddhi such as Bhava and others, and for the purification of the body.

analyzed: prakāśitam mahākāla tava sneha vaśāt api
translated: O Mahākāla, this has been revealed out of affection for you.

analyzed: sarve mantrāḥ sammoha kavaca āśrayāḥ
translated: All mantras are accomplished by relying on the Sammohaka armor.

analyzed: kavacasya ṛṣiḥ brahmā chandaḥ nuṣṭubh udāhṛtam
translated: The sage of the armor is said to be Brahmā, the meter is said to be anuṣṭubh,

original: īśvaro devatā prokta stathā śaktiśca kākinī // //
analyzed: īśvaraḥ devatā proktaḥ stathā śaktiḥ ca kākinī
translated: the deity is declared to be Īśvara, and the power is the female bee.

analyzed: kīlakam krūṃ tathā jñeyam dhyāna sādhana siddhaye
translated: The nail is to be known as krūṃ for the sake of accomplishing meditation.

analyzed: hṛd abja bhedana arthe tu viniyogaḥ prakītītaḥ
translated: The application is declared to be for the purpose of piercing the lotus of the heart.

original: etacchrīsammohanamahākavacasya brahmā ṛṣiranuṣṭup chanda īśvaro devatā kākinī śaktiḥ krūṃ kīlakaṃ
analyzed: etat śrī sammohana mahā kavacasya brahmā ṛṣiḥ anuṣṭubh chandaḥ īśvaraḥ devatā kākinī śaktiḥ krūṃ kīlakam
translated: The sage of this Śrī Sammohana Mahākavaca is Brahmā, the meter is anuṣṭubh, the deity is Īśvara, the power is the female bee, the nail is krūṃ,
for the sake of accomplishing meditation, the application is for the purpose of piercing the lotus of the heart in japa.

original: praṇavo me pātu śīrṣaṃ lalāṭaṃ ca sadāśivaḥ /🔽prāsādo hṛdayaṃ pātu bāhuyugmaṃ maheśvaraḥ // //
analyzed: praṇavaḥ me pātu śīrṣam lalāṭam ca sadāśivaḥ  prāsādaḥ hṛdayam pātu bāhu yugmam maheśvaraḥ  /
translated: May the praṇava always protect my head and forehead, and Sadāśiva,🔽may the Prāsāda protect my heart, and Maheśvara my two arms.

analyzed: pṛṣṭham pātu mahādevaḥ udaram kāmanāśanaḥ
translated: May Mahādeva protect my back, and Kāmanāśana my belly,

analyzed: pārśvau pātu kāma rājaḥ bālaḥ pṛṣṭha tala antaram
translated: may Kāmarāja protect my sides, and the child the inner part of my back.

analyzed: kukṣi mūlam mahā vīraḥ lalitā patiḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: The great hero, the lord of Lalitā, Īśvara, may protect the root of my belly,

analyzed: mṛtyuñjayaḥ nīlakaṇṭhaḥ liṅga deśam sadā avatu
translated: May Mṛtyuñjaya (Conqueror of Death), Nīlakaṇṭha (Blue-throated One) always protect the region of the Liṅga (phallus).
May the ring (worn on the finger) protect below the Liṅga, may the Lord of Umā (Śiva) protect the pair of feet.

analyzed: aṅguṣṭham pātu satatam pārvatī prāṇa vallabhaḥ
translated: May the beloved of Pārvatī's life always protect the thumb.

analyzed: gulpham pātu trayambakaḥ ca jānunī yuvatīpatiḥ
translated: May Tryambaka (Three-eyed One) protect the ankle, may the Lord of the young woman protect the knees.

analyzed: ūru mūlam sadā pātu mañjughoṣaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: May the eternal Mañjughoṣa (Sweet-voiced One) always protect the root of the thigh.

analyzed: simanī deśam āpātu bhairavaḥ krodhabhairavaḥ
translated: May Bhairava, the wrathful Bhairava, protect the region of the forehead.
May the Lord of the universe in the form of the Liṅga protect the emergence from the region of the Liṅga.

original: hṛdayāgraṃ sadā pātu maheśaḥ kākinīśvaraḥ /🔽grīvāṃ pātu vṛṣasthaśca kaṇṭhadeśaṃ digambaraḥ // //
analyzed: hṛdaya agram sadā pātu maheśaḥ kākinīśvaraḥ  grīvām pātu vṛṣa sthaḥ ca kaṇṭha deśam digambaraḥ
translated: May Maheśa (Great Lord), the Lord of the Kākini (a kind of Yoginī), always protect the tip of the heart.🔽May the one seated on the bull (Nandi) protect the neck, may the naked one (Śiva) protect the region of the throat.

original: lambikāṃ pātu gaṇapo nāsikāṃ bhavanāśakaḥ /🔽bhrūmadhyaṃ pātu yogīndraḥ maheśaḥ pātu mastakam // //
analyzed: lambikām pātu gaṇapaḥ nāsikām bhava nāśakaḥ  bhrūmadhyam pātu yogi indraḥ maheśaḥ pātu mastakam
translated: May Gaṇapati (Lord of the Ganas) protect the uvula, may the destroyer of worldly existence protect the nose.🔽May the Lord of Yogis (Śiva) protect the middle of the eyebrows, may Maheśa (Great Lord) protect the head.

analyzed: muni indraḥ ca dvādaśa sthaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: May the Lord of Maheśvara (Śiva), the Lord of sages, in the twelfth place, protect the region of the head.
May the beloved of the Kākini (a kind of Yoginī) protect the twelve-petalled lotus.

analyzed: pātu
translated: May Mahārudra (Great Rudra), who is full of the universe, protect the lotus at the root of the navel.

original: svādhiṣṭhānāmbujaṃ pātu sadā hariharātmakaḥ // //🔽mūlapadmaṃ sadā pātu brahmendro ḍākinīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: svādhiṣṭhāna ambujam pātu sadā hari hara ātmakaḥ
translated: May the one consisting of Hari and Hara always protect the lotus of the secret place.🔽May Brahma, Indra, and the lord of Dakinis always protect the root lotus.

analyzed: kuṇḍalīm sarvadā pātu ḍākinī yoginīśvaraḥ
translated: May the lord of Yoginis and Dakinis always protect Kundalini.

original: kuṇḍalī mātṛkā pātu vaṭukeśaḥ śivoro / haraḥ /
analyzed: kuṇḍalī mātṛkā pātu vaṭuka īśaḥ śiva uraḥ haraḥ
translated: May Shiva, the lord of the mother goddesses, protect Kundalini.

analyzed: rākiṇī vigraham pātu vāmadevaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: May Mahesvara, Vamadeva, protect the form of Rakini.

original: pañcānanaḥ sadā pātu lākinīvajravigraham /🔽svasthānaṃ dvādaśārañca vīraḥ pātu sukākinīm // //
analyzed: sva sthānam dvādaśa aran ca vīraḥ pātu sukākinīm
translated: May the five-faced one always protect the form of Vajra Lakini.🔽May the hero always protect the twelve-petaled lotus and Suka Lakini in its own place.

analyzed: vīra indraḥ kaṇīkām pātu dvādaśa aram viṣa aśanaḥ
translated: May the lord of heroes protect the pistil cup, the twelve-petaled lotus, and the poison-eater.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśāram sadā pātu krodhavīraḥ sadāśivaḥ
translated: May Sadashiva, the wrathful hero, always protect the sixteen-petaled lotus.

original: māṃ pātu vajranātheśo'ribhayāt krodhabhairavaḥ /🔽ṣaṭcakraṃ sarvadā pātu lākinīśrīsadāśivaḥ // //
analyzed: mām pātu vajranātha īśa ūri bhayāt krodhabhairavaḥ
translated: May the lord of Vajra-natha, the wrathful Bhairava, protect me from the fear of enemies.🔽May Sadashiva, the lord of Lakini, always protect the six cakras.
May the protector of Dhumraksha protect the one residing in the sixteen-petaled lotus.

analyzed: diṅnātha īśaḥ mahākāyaḥ mām pātu parameśvaraḥ
translated: May the great-bodied lord of the lords of directions, the supreme lord, protect me.

analyzed: ākāśagaṅgā jaṭilaḥ dvi dalam pātu me param
translated: May the one adorned with the Ganges in the sky protect my two petals.

analyzed: gaṅgādharaḥ sadā pātu hākinīm parameśvaraḥ
translated: May the supreme lord, the bearer of the Ganges, always protect Hakini.

analyzed: hākinī para śivaḥ me bhūḥ apadmam parirakṣatu
translated: May the supreme Shiva, the female energy, protect my lotus of the earth.

analyzed: daṇḍapāṇi īśvaraḥ pātu manaḥ rūpam dvi patrakam
translated: May the lord of the staff protect my mind form and the two petals.
May the good-haired one always protect the one residing in the mind's beyond and so on.

original: piṅgākṣeśaḥ sadā pātu bhayabhūmau tanūṃ mama // //
analyzed: piṅga akṣa īśaḥ sadā pātu bhaya bhūmau tanūm mama  /
translated: May the lord of the tawny-eyed one always protect my body in the fearful place.

analyzed: unmanī sthānakam pātu rodhinī sahitam mama
translated: May the place of the beyond-mind protect me along with the obstructing one.

analyzed: sahasranāma yoga aṅgam aṣṭottaraśata anvitam
translated: The Yoga-limbs along with the one hundred and eight names.

original: yaḥ paṭhenniyataḥ śrīmān sa yogī nātra saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet niyataḥ śrīmān sa yogī na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: The glorious one who recites this with restraint is a yogi, there is no doubt about it.

original: asya smaraṇamātreṇa vīro yogeśvaro bhavet /🔽asyāpi ca phalaṃ vaktuṃ koṭivarṣaśatairapi // //
analyzed: asya smaraṇa mātreṇa vīraḥ yogeśvaraḥ bhavet  asya api ca phalam vaktum koṭi varṣa śataiḥ api
translated: By merely remembering this, one becomes a hero and a lord of yogis.🔽Even in hundreds of millions of years, it is not possible to describe the fruits of this.

original: śakyate nāpi sahasā saṃkṣepāt śṛṇu satphalam /
analyzed: śakyate nā api sahasā saṃkṣepāt śṛṇu sat phalam
translated: Listen to the good fruits in brief.

original: āyurārogyamāpnoti viśvāsaṃ śrīguroḥ padaiḥ // //🔽sārasiddhikaraṃ puṇyaṃ pavitraṃ pāpanāśanam /
analyzed: āyuḥ ārogyam āpnoti viśvāsam śrī guroḥ padaiḥ  sāra siddhi karam puṇyam pavitram pāpa nāśanam
translated: By the words of the revered guru, one attains long life and good health.🔽This is meritorious, purifying, and destructive of sins, which brings about the essence of accomplishment.
It burns away extreme misery and bestows all good fortune.

analyzed: paṭhanāt sarvadā yoga siddhim āpnoti yogi rāj
translated: By reciting this, the king of yogis always attains the accomplishment of yoga.

analyzed: deha siddhiḥ kāvya siddhiḥ jñāna siddhiḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: The accomplishment of the body, the accomplishment of poetry, and the accomplishment of knowledge will surely occur.

analyzed: vācām siddhiḥ khaḍga siddhiḥ khecara tvam avāpnuyāt
translated: The accomplishment of speech, the accomplishment of the sword, and the ability to fly in the sky will be attained.
The yogi becomes beloved in the three worlds and attains accomplishment in all desired goals.

analyzed: aprakāśyam mahā ratnam paṭhitvā siddhim āpnuyāt
translated: By reciting this great jewel, which should not be revealed, one attains accomplishment.

analyzed: asya prapaṭhanena api bhrū padme cittam arpayan
translated: By reciting this, with the mind focused on the lotus of the eyebrows,

analyzed: yaśaḥ bhāgyam avāpnoti rājarāja īśvaraḥ bhavet
translated: one attains fame and good fortune and becomes a king of kings.

analyzed: ḍākinī siddhim āpnoti kuṇḍalī vaśam ānayet
translated: One attains the accomplishment of the Dākinī and can bring under control the Kuṇḍalinī.

original: dhyānātmā sādhakendraśca yatirbhūtvā śubhe dine /🔽dhyānaṃ kuryāt padmamadhyakaṇīkāyāṃ śikhālaye // //
analyzed: dhyāna ātmā sādhaka indraḥ ca yatiḥ bhūtvā śubhe dine  dhyānam kuryāt padma madhya kaṇīkāyām śikhā ālaye
translated: The lord of adepts, whose soul is meditation, having become an ascetic on an auspicious day,🔽should meditate in the abode of the tuft, in the center of the lotus calyx.

original: bhrūmadhye cakrasāre ca dhyātvā dhyātvā paṭhed yadi /
analyzed: bhrū madhye cakrasāre ca dhyātvā dhyātvā paṭhet yadi
translated: If one meditates and recites, in the center of the eyebrows, in the essence of the cakra,

analyzed: rākiṇī siddhim āpnoti devatā darśanam labhet  bhāgya siddhim avāpnoti nityam prapaṭhana ādi atas
translated: one attains the accomplishment of the Rākini and obtains the vision of the deity.🔽One attains the accomplishment of good fortune, because of reciting daily.

original: sākṣātsiddhimavāpnoti śaktiyuktaḥ paṭhedyadi // //🔽hiraṇyākṣī lākinīśā vaśamāpnoti dhairyavān /
analyzed: sākṣāt siddhim avāpnoti śakti yuktaḥ paṭhet yadi  hiraṇyākṣī lākinī īśā vaśam āpnoti dhairyavān
translated: If one who is endowed with power recites, one attains accomplishment directly.🔽The bold one attains control over the Rākini, the queen of the Lakinis.

analyzed: rātri śeṣe samutthāya paṭhet yadi śivālaye
translated: If one gets up in the remaining part of the night and recites in a Shiva temple,

original: pūjānte vā japānte vā vāramekaṃ paṭhedyadi /
analyzed: pūjā ante vā japa ante vā vāram ekam paṭhet yadi
translated: if one recites once at the end of worship or at the end of japa,

analyzed: vīra siddhim avāpnoti kākinī vaśam ānayet
translated: one attains the accomplishment of the hero and can bring the Kākinī under control.

analyzed: rātrim vyāpya paṭhet yaḥ tu śuddha cetāḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: One who recites throughout the night, with a pure mind and controlled senses,

analyzed: śayyāyām caṇḍikā gehe punar
translated: in a bed, in a temple of Chandika, or in a temple of Madhu,

analyzed: śākinī siddhim āpnoti sarva deśe ca sarvadā
translated: attains the accomplishment of the Shakini everywhere and at all times.

original: prabhāte ca samutthāya śuddhātmā pañcame dine // //
analyzed: prabhāte ca samutthāya śuddha ātmā pañcame dine
translated: And rising in the morning, with a pure soul, on the fifth day,

analyzed: amāvāsyāsu vijñāyām śravaṇāyām viśeṣataḥ
translated: On the new moon day, especially on the full moon day of Śravaṇa,

analyzed: śukla pakṣe navamyām tu kṛṣṇa pakṣa iṣṭamī dine
translated: On the ninth day of the bright fortnight, and on the eighth day of the dark fortnight,

analyzed: bhāryā yuktaḥ paṭhet yaḥ tu vaśam āpnoti bhūpatim
translated: One who recites this in union with his wife will bring a king under his control.

analyzed: ekākī nirjane deśe kāma jetā mahā balī  /
translated: Alone in a secluded place, he will conquer desire and become greatly powerful.

original: prapaṭhed rātriśeṣe ca sa bhavet sādhakottamaḥ /
analyzed: prapaṭhet rātri śeṣe ca sa bhavet sādhaka uttamaḥ
translated: If one recites this at the end of the night, he will become the best of adepts.

analyzed: kalpadruma samaḥ dātā deva jetā na saṃśayaḥ  śiva śakti madhya bhāge yantram saṃsthāpya yatnatas
translated: He will be like the wish-fulfilling tree in giving, and will conquer the gods, there is no doubt.🔽Having carefully installed the yantra in the middle of Śiva and Śakti,

analyzed: prapaṭhet sādhaka indraḥ ca sarvajñātā sthira āśayaḥ  ekānta nirjane ramye tapaḥ siddhi phala udaye
translated: The best of adepts, with a firm resolve for omniscience, should recite it.🔽In a secluded, beautiful place, where the fruits of austerities arise,

analyzed: deśe sthitvā paṭhet yaḥ tu jīvanmukti phalam labhet
translated: One who recites this will attain the fruits of liberation while alive.

analyzed: akāle api sa kāle api paṭhitvā siddhim āpnuyāt
translated: Even out of season, one will attain success by reciting it in season.

analyzed: tri kālam yaḥ tu paṭhati prāntare vā catuṣpathe
translated: One who recites it three times a day, in a lonely place or at a crossroads,

analyzed: yoginīnām patiḥ sākṣāt āyuḥ vṛddhi dīne dine
translated: Will be the lord of yoginīs in reality, and his lifespan will increase day by day.

analyzed: vāram ekam paṭhet yaḥ tu mūrkhaḥ vā paṇḍitaḥ api vā  vācām īśaḥ bhavet kṣipram yoga yuktaḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: Even if one recites it only once, whether one is a fool or a scholar,🔽One will quickly become the lord of speech and will certainly become endowed with yoga.

analyzed: sambhāvitaḥ bhavet ekam vāra pāṭhena bhairava
translated: O Bhairava, by reciting it once, one will be respected by all.

analyzed: jitvā kāla mahā mṛtyum devī bhaktim avāpnuyāt

analyzed: paṭhitvā vāram ekam tu yātrām kurvanti ye janāḥ

translated: Will attain success in seeing the Goddess and will obtain yoga.

analyzed: pratyekam nāmam uccārya yaḥ yāgam anusañcaret
translated: One who performs a sacrifice after uttering each name,

analyzed: bhū tale bhūbhṛtām nāthaḥ mahā siddhaḥ mahā kaviḥ
translated: On earth, he will become the lord of kings, a great adept, and a great poet.

analyzed: kaṇṭhe śīrṣe dakṣa bhuje puruṣaḥ dhārayet yadi
translated: If a man wears it on his neck, head, or right arm,

translated: And a woman wears it on her left arm, she will obtain all accomplishments.🔽O Mahesani, one should write the mantra with cow bezoar, saffron, red sandalwood,

translated: Or barley grains, with a focused mind.

analyzed: vāra eka mātra pāṭhena varṣe varṣe dine dine

translated: By your grace, I am the lord of the sky-walkers, Bhairavas, and yogis,

analyzed: idānīm kathaye teham nija deha su siddhaye

translated: For the sake of obeying your command, for the destruction of the Kalakuta poison.🔽Listen to that for the sake of devotion, action, liberation and enjoyment, O Lord.

analyzed: om hsau sāṃ pareśaḥ ca parāśaktiḥ priyeśvaraḥ
translated: Om, Hsau, the supreme Lord, the supreme power, the beloved Lord,

The beloved of Parvati, the prosperous, the friend of the poor, the three-eyed one,
The soul of yoga, the giver of yoga, the lord of the Siddhas, the hero, the destroyer of sound,
The lord of Kapila, the guru, sung, self-beloved, the enchanter of song,

analyzed: go koṭi dāna karttā ca go koṭi dugdha bhojanaḥ
translated: He is the giver of a million cows, and has eaten the milk of a million cows.

The soul of rays, the soul of causes, the lord of the shade of the Kalpa tree, the moon,
The knower of the supreme, the giver of supreme bliss, the lord who conquers through Dharma,
The king of the lotus eyes with three eyes, the long-eyed one, the charming one,
The lord of Chamundi, the fierce lord, the lord of the Paribhadra tree, Hara,

translated: Known as the concealer, the lord of cattle wealth, the one with a beautiful face, the one clad in the sky,
